Title: Data Scientist - Internship
HTML:
Create your own future

We are looking for an enthusiastic and compassionate intern to support the CMO Analytics team. You will directly get your hands dirty with data and programming. You will work among other highly motivated people who all aim to deliver business value by deploying data tools ready to be used.

That is what you will use your talents for as a Driving Data Analytics Intern at Van Lanschot Kempen. You will use your people & communication skills to inspire, convince and support digital and data adoption. During this internship you will work in a dynamic environment with various multidisciplinary DevOps teams and departments like the commercial colleagues of the Private Bank, Investment & Fiduciary Managers and Operations teams like Client Monitoring.

You also have the following tasks:

  • Work with a Product Owner and specialist to gather project requirements and implement a plan of action;
  • Work on data visualisation using preferably Power BI;
  • Develop or improve machine learning models;
  • Work with Azure DevOps and Azure Data Factory;
  • Create and maintain data engineering pipelines that fuel our ML models.

Your talents

Dynamic, outgoing and digital savvy. This is how we can best describe you in the position of Driving Data & Analytics Intern. Talents that you use to guide our customers in a constantly changing world every day. By thinking out of the box and asking questions. And all will be well if you also are analytical, result-oriented and have a hands-on mentality. In addition:

  • You are master's student in computer science, econometrics, statistics, data science or analytics with one or two courses in statistics, machine learning, data science or software development;
  • You have hands-on knowledge on backend programming, preferably python/SQL and front-end implementation in JavaScript/Node JS;
  • You have a good knowledge of PowerBI and Data Bricks;
  • You are available for at least 5 months for 32 to 40 hours a week;
  • You are passionate about new technology and tools and like to work with data;
  • Finance background and knowledge is a nice to have;
  • You have a good mastery of English, both oral and written.

Move ahead at Van Lanschot Kempen

Investing in a more future-oriented, sustainable, and data-driven way with various clients. Both nationally and internationally. With almost 300 years of experience, we make this ambition a reality at Van Lanschot Kempen. We do this with some 2,000 colleagues in various fields of expertise.

The Digital Innovation and Advanced Analytics department operates from the heart of Van Lanschot Kempen. It has four analytics teams that consist of highly skilled and motivated Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers & BI Dashboarding specialists. Enabling the entire Wealth Manager supercharging their decision-making by creating models, tools & dashboards for the commercial organisation, investment management and staff departments like Internal Control and Compliance. The teams work cloud native (Azure), with the latest techniques and languages. The department drives the organisation to work increasingly data-driven!

An organisation's degree of innovation and agility also depends on the diversity of its workforce. Our differences make us stronger together. We promote an inclusive work environment where all colleagues feel at home. With us, you can be yourself. And we are proud of that.

Curious about the stories of colleagues and how they experience working at Van Lanschot Kempen? Go to People & Projects and find out more!

Turning talent into value!

That’s what we do. The fact is, if you add value, you can obviously expect the same from us in return. In the Driving Data & Analytics Internship you will also be given:

  • Compensation of € 800,00 gross per month (based on 40h per week);
  • A company laptop and first access to the most innovative tools/products;
  • A creative and agile environment where you cooperate with ambitious teams;
  • A lot of responsibility and a large amount of autonomy;
  • A passionate internship supervisor who is a specialist in data science;
  • An environment to learn, make mistakes and develop yourself;
  • The opportunity to have an impact in one of the largest Wealth Managers in Benelux.

Working on tomorrow's capital

Just the vacancy you were looking for? Please submit your application.

Do you have any questions about the recruitment process? Please get in touch with Jessica Martins, Campus Recruiter, on +31 (0)6 57683187 or at j.martins@vanlanschotkempen.com

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
I am partnered with an exciting Artificial Intelligence💫 research start-up based in Rotterdam, Specializing in automating the visual surveying of industrial assets.




Apply now and become a part of a rapidly growing and visionary company 🚀







Key Responsibilities




Overseeing the performance of AI models, and making sure that they are constantly being improved with the new data received from our clients.
Identifying new approaches that can further improve the performance of AI models through data augmentation, as well as pre and post processing methods.
Quickly recognizes opportunities and develops creative solutions that add to the company's unique selling proposition, this can also be related to components outside of AI.
Conducts quality control of all models and systems to ensure an overall robust infrastructure; this includes overseeing and potentially managing a small labeling team for projects that are assigned to you.
Making the AI production ready by increasing performance and reducing processing times through improvement of the actual AI pipeline.







Required Skills and Abilities




A Master or PhD degree in AI, Computer science, Engineering or any other related technical field.
Experience in full stack development
3+ years of experience developing and designing Computer Vision technologies and systems.
You have hands-on experience with deep/machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.
Strong commercial experience with Python.
Industry experience with software such as Git, Linux.
Experience in GIS/Geomatics
Able to perform multiple tasks, balance priorities, and meet deadlines; ability to work under pressure.
Able to work independently and as a member of a multidisciplinary agile-driven team.
Takes initiative and has a high level of ambition, motivation, and passion.
Must be based in the Netherlands, preferably close to Rotterdam.







Benefits:

salary package up to 75,000 gross
Travel allowance
Flexible working




Make sure to apply here or contact me: @george.rayner@vivdresourcing.com

Title: Junior/medior Data Scientist
Description:
Ben je gepassioneerd over het uitbreiden van de mogelijkheden in data science? Bij deze organisatie zijn ze op zoek naar getalenteerde specialisten om de ontwikkeling en implementatie van hun machine learning-toepassingen te versnellen.




Over de functie

Bij dit bedrijf gaat het Artificial Intelligence-team verder dan alleen onderzoek en prototypen. Ze zijn toegewijd aan het onderhouden, verbeteren en uitbreiden van een divers portfolio van ML- en AI-toepassingen die al in productie zijn, en ze blijven hun diensten verrijken met innovatieve oplossingen. Naast de continue ontwikkeling hanteren ze state-of-the-art data science en machine learning-methodologieën om te integreren en te werken aan een volledig geautomatiseerde supply chain.




Wat ga je doen?

Ontwikkelen en testen van nieuwe prototypes om onze machine learning-capaciteiten te verbeteren.
Assisteren bij data-exploratie, feature-engineering en modelselectieprocessen.
Bijdragen aan het onderzoek en de ontwikkeling van nieuwe functionaliteiten.
Samenwerken met senior teamleden om te leren en te groeien in je ML- en AI-carrière.
Schrijven van (bijna) productieklare code en pakketten in Python.
Het werk van anderen beoordelen en constructieve feedback geven (bijv. codebeoordelingen).
Documenteren en presenteren van projectresultaten op een duidelijke en professionele manier.
Onafhankelijk werken met minimale supervisie.







Over de organisatie

Het team gedijt op samenwerking, zowel intern als met externe partners, om de complexiteit van moderne supply chains aan te pakken. Door de expertise te delen binnen het team en de bredere organisatie, streven we ernaar om aan de behoeften van onze klanten te voldoen en de hoge servicestandaarden die ons merk definiëren, te handhaven.







Wie ben jij

Een MSc in computerwetenschappen, machine learning of een andere relevante kwantitatieve discipline.
Goede kennis van machine learning-algoritmen en data-analysetechnieken.
Leergierigheid, experimenteerdrang en de wil om bij te dragen aan innovatieve projecten.
Minimaal 1/2 jaar relevante ervaring.
Vertrouwd met relationele databases (voornamelijk SQL Server).
Interesse in supply chain en voorraadbeheer.
Uitstekende schrijf- en verbale vaardigheden.
Een teamspeler en leergierig.
Een hands-on mentaliteit







Wat bieden we je

Salaris tot €55.000 per jaar (40 uur)
Flexibel werkbeleid. Mogelijkheid om vier dagen in de week thuis te werken
Werken in een ervaren Artificial Intelligence team
Uitstekend pakket aan secundaire voorwaarden
Persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling in een groeiend bedrijf
Werken in een leuke, informele en internationale werkomgeving
Veel vrijheid en ruimte op eigen ideeën te implementeren




Interesse?

Herken jij jezelf in deze beschrijving en ben je klaar voor de volgende stap in je carrière? Neem dan contact op met Tim




t.brillenburg@elevationpartners.nl




Stuur je een recent CV mee, zodat we direct kunnen zien of jouw ervaring past bij het profiel.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
*ML Engineer*

Amsterdam

Hybrid







About

Their mission is to share their passion for music videos with the world and invite people to experience music beyond listening: to see your music. Based in Amsterdam, the comapany now reaches 100 million households across multiple territories through linear networks, interactive TV apps, and on-demand streaming services. They revolutionize the way audiences experience music videos by allowing viewers to search, like, and skip through the entire catalogue, enjoy channels curated by their team of music experts, and create their own channels using the unique Mixer feature. With a full music video catalogue from major and top independent music labels, they work every day to expand our offerings.




About the Role

They are looking for a passionate Mid+/Senior Python Engineer in the Data/ML domain to join the team. You will be responsible for the machine learning services in production, including software and service design/development, monitoring, practical MLOps, performance, and architecture. You will work closely with Data Science, Data Analytics, Backend Engineering teams, and other technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Responsibilities

Design, develop, and scale new/existing data and machine learning pipelines (ETLs, feature stores, productize model training and serving), data products, and services.
Resolve problems with end-to-end ownership of machine learning and data preparation/transformation pipelines.
Assist colleagues with technical challenges.
Design, test, install, and maintain highly scalable and data-intensive systems.
Review, maintain, refactor, and extend distributed systems in production. Support other teams for usage and integration with those systems.
Maintain the technical excellence of the data, ML, and software engineering practices.
Work on shared libraries, infrastructure, and building blocks within the monorepo space.
Collaborate with the Product Manager and other stakeholders, participating in forming, prioritizing, and executing the data-intensive products backlog.




Job Requirements

Broad interest and experience within ML/Data domains.
Proven professional experience as a Software Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, or Data Engineer, working with systems and data infrastructure at scale.
Experience with crafting and building large-scale data pipelines in distributed environments with technologies such as Kafka, ClickHouse, Elastic, Cassandra, Spark/PySpark, or similar.
Experience with data streams processing tools and concepts.
Experience optimizing ML models, services, pipelines, and procedures for performance, cost, and usability.
Knowledge of main architecture models and concepts like replication, sharding, consistency, horizontal and vertical scaling, idempotency.
Experience with MLOps practices, building and deploying ML models and data pipelines.
Preferably a university degree in Software Engineering or other relevant fields or comparable work experience.
Experience with data pipeline orchestrators such as AirFlow, Kubeflow, Dagster, or similar.
Excellent analytical and communication skills.
Experience in operationalizing recommender systems is a plus.




Tech Stack:

Languages: Python 3 (Pandas, Polars, NumPy, Pydantic), Scala (cats, cats-effect, fs2)
Technologies: Kafka, ClickHouse, PostgreSQL, Redis, MongoDB, Memgraph, GCP Buckets, MLFlow, Prometheus
Tools: Bazel, Docker, Kubernetes, Airflow, GCP
Platforms: GitHub, CircleCI, Ansible, Superset, Grafana, and many other mostly open-source technologies




They ensure you’re taken care of by providing you the opportunity to develop your career in a young, fast-growing, and international company. They offer a challenging work environment with a lot of autonomy, flexible working hours, and no two days being the same.

Show more
HTML:
*ML Engineer*

Amsterdam

Hybrid



About

Their mission is to share their passion for music videos with the world and invite people to experience music beyond listening: to see your music. Based in Amsterdam, the comapany now reaches 100 million households across multiple territories through linear networks, interactive TV apps, and on-demand streaming services. They revolutionize the way audiences experience music videos by allowing viewers to search, like, and skip through the entire catalogue, enjoy channels curated by their team of music experts, and create their own channels using the unique Mixer feature. With a full music video catalogue from major and top independent music labels, they work every day to expand our offerings.


About the Role

They are looking for a passionate Mid+/Senior Python Engineer in the Data/ML domain to join the team. You will be responsible for the machine learning services in production, including software and service design/development, monitoring, practical MLOps, performance, and architecture. You will work closely with Data Science, Data Analytics, Backend Engineering teams, and other technical and non-technical stakeholders.


Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and scale new/existing data and machine learning pipelines (ETLs, feature stores, productize model training and serving), data products, and services.
  • Resolve problems with end-to-end ownership of machine learning and data preparation/transformation pipelines.
  • Assist colleagues with technical challenges.
  • Design, test, install, and maintain highly scalable and data-intensive systems.
  • Review, maintain, refactor, and extend distributed systems in production. Support other teams for usage and integration with those systems.
  • Maintain the technical excellence of the data, ML, and software engineering practices.
  • Work on shared libraries, infrastructure, and building blocks within the monorepo space.
  • Collaborate with the Product Manager and other stakeholders, participating in forming, prioritizing, and executing the data-intensive products backlog.


Job Requirements

  • Broad interest and experience within ML/Data domains.
  • Proven professional experience as a Software Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, or Data Engineer, working with systems and data infrastructure at scale.
  • Experience with crafting and building large-scale data pipelines in distributed environments with technologies such as Kafka, ClickHouse, Elastic, Cassandra, Spark/PySpark, or similar.
  • Experience with data streams processing tools and concepts.
  • Experience optimizing ML models, services, pipelines, and procedures for performance, cost, and usability.
  • Knowledge of main architecture models and concepts like replication, sharding, consistency, horizontal and vertical scaling, idempotency.
  • Experience with MLOps practices, building and deploying ML models and data pipelines.
  • Preferably a university degree in Software Engineering or other relevant fields or comparable work experience.
  • Experience with data pipeline orchestrators such as AirFlow, Kubeflow, Dagster, or similar.
  • Excellent analytical and communication skills.
  • Experience in operationalizing recommender systems is a plus.


Tech Stack:

  • Languages: Python 3 (Pandas, Polars, NumPy, Pydantic), Scala (cats, cats-effect, fs2)
  • Technologies: Kafka, ClickHouse, PostgreSQL, Redis, MongoDB, Memgraph, GCP Buckets, MLFlow, Prometheus
  • Tools: Bazel, Docker, Kubernetes, Airflow, GCP
  • Platforms: GitHub, CircleCI, Ansible, Superset, Grafana, and many other mostly open-source technologies


They ensure you’re taken care of by providing you the opportunity to develop your career in a young, fast-growing, and international company. They offer a challenging work environment with a lot of autonomy, flexible working hours, and no two days being the same.

Title: Internship: Data Science
Place: Alphen aan den Rijn, South Holland, Netherlands
Description:
Avery Dennison Corporation (NYSE: AVY) is a global materials science and digital identification solutions company that provides a wide range of branding and information solutions that optimize labor and supply chain efficiency, reduce waste, advance sustainability, circularity and transparency, and better connect brands and consumers. Our products and solutions include labeling and functional materials, radio frequency identification (RFID) inlays and tags, software applications that connect the physical and digital, and a variety of products and solutions that enhance branded packaging and carry or display information that improves the customer experience. Serving an array of industries worldwide — including home and personal care, apparel, general retail, e-commerce, logistics, food and grocery, pharmaceuticals and automotive — we employ approximately 35,000 employees in more than 50 countries. Our reported sales in 2023 were $8.4 billion. Learn more at www.averydennison.com.


Avery Dennison is an equal opportunity employer.


Please let us know if we can support you with reasonable accommodations throughout the application process by contacting our team via Requestaccomodation@eu.averydennison.com.




Job Description



Do you want to put your engineering and analytical skills into practice in a diverse and global manufacturing company?


As a Data Science Intern, you will be responsible for improving and validating our predictive model. You will also collect new data, specifically viscosity measurements of PVC organosols with different formulations. These measurements are conducted in the lab and do not require prior experience in laboratory work. Once collected, you will preprocess the data and integrate it into the machine learning model. You will also re-train the model to enhance its accuracy and performance. Additionally, you will be responsible for creating an user interface and ensuring a smooth implementation of the model in the production area. This role offers a great opportunity to apply advanced machine learning techniques and data analytics in a practical setting, contributing to the optimisation of our production processes.


Your main responsibilities will be:


Collect viscosity measurements of PVC organosols
Preprocess and integrate collected data into the machine learning model
Retrain the predictive model to improve its accuracy and performance
Develop and implement an user interface for the model
Ensure smooth integration of the model in the production area
Monitor and maintain the performance of the model (prepare)

The preferred start date is 1st October 2024 or earlier. The ideal candidate is available 4 to 5 days a week for 6 months. The location of the position is our site in Alphen aan den Rijn. This is a hands-on internship experience which involves lots of lab work and requires working from the site physically.




Qualifications



What kind of candidate are we looking for?


Currently following a Bachelor or Master degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or related field
Advanced understanding of machine learning algorithms and techniques
Proficiency in Python and familiarity in relevant libraries
Understanding of Chemistry or Chemical Engineering is a plus
Someone with good communication skills in English
Someone who is independent and can lead their own projects


Additional Information



Our offer


550 euros per month compensation on a full-time basis
Commuting allowance (if applicable)
Specific training offerings during your internship to support your development
Team-oriented and highly international environment, in which you get responsibility and the possibility to test your talents

Important: Only applications in English will be considered! Applicants need to be enrolled at a Dutch university for the whole duration of the internship.


----


Note: We do not accept unsolicited referrals or resumes from any source other than directly from candidates using their personal email addresses.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Coders Connect is excited to partner with a groundbreaking company driving the energy transition in the Netherlands. This innovative organization is harnessing cutting-edge technology to optimize real assets and batteries, creating immediate impact for both customers and society at large. They’re on a mission to build a sustainable future, and we’re helping them find a confident, independent Senior Data Scientist to lead the charge.




What You'll Be Doing:

Leading and growing the Data Science function within the business.
Taking existing algorithms to the next level through innovation and cloud deployment on AWS.
Applying your expertise in Time Series analysis while working hands-on with Python, SQL, and advanced technologies such as Pytorch and Tensorflow.
Implementing data models that deliver actionable insights to drive business value and accelerate societal impact.




Requirements:

5+ years of experience in Data Science, with strong Python and SQL skills.
Expertise in Time Series analysis with a solid mathematical foundation.
Cloud deployment experience using AWS.
An independent, curious problem-solver who thrives on ownership and enjoys implementing innovative models.
While experience in the energy sector is a plus, it’s not a must.




Benefits:

Be at the heart of the energy transition, working on projects that have an immediate and tangible real-world impact.
Shape the future of the Data Science department with the freedom to implement your ideas and make a direct contribution to the company’s growth.
Join a close-knit team, working alongside a CTO, three developers, and a part-time Data Scientist, all committed to advancing technology in this rapidly growing sector.
Hybrid work environment in the vibrant city of Utrecht.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist / ML engineer / Amsterdam / Hybrid




A large enterprise customer of ours is undergoing a transformation specifically aimed at growth and marketing area. They are seeking a talented Data Scientist to come on board and offer their expertise in a brand new greenfield assignment amongst a multi-disciplinary teams







The purpose of this area is to create customer demand, engagement, and loyalty with the brand by amplifying the commercial offer and we need predictive modelling for marketing and growth!

5+ years of Data Science experience at enterprise level
Predictive modelling, statistics and Machine learning experience
Python
BigQuery




Desirable:




LLM (Large language models)
Generative AI exposure

4 month initial contract - view to extend in January - (its a 2 year project)
Self employed rate €80 - 85 per hour / 40 hours a week
Payroll salary = €7000 - 8000 a month
1 day a week in Amsterdam / 4 days remote







Apply today for a further discussion!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At Brunel, we partner with leading financial institutions to deliver innovative data solutions that enhance their business outcomes. We are currently seeking a talented Data Scientist to join our team for a critical project with one of our top clients—a leading European bank. This project focuses on reshaping their risk models as part of their Future Model Landscape initiative, with the goal of optimizing their capital position and meeting strict regulatory standards.

As a Data Scientist, you will be integral to the System Driven Remediation Team, working directly with our client to ensure that their risk models are supported by high-quality, reliable data. Your role will involve sourcing, analyzing, and remediating data to ensure it meets the rigorous standards required for Risk Weighted Assets (RWA) calculations and other risk-related metrics. Your contributions will directly impact our client’s ability to optimize their capital position and achieve their financial goals.

Over deze functie


Analyze and model data, constructing datasets from source to desired cubes, ensuring data quality and traceability.
Identify and address data quality issues, developing and executing remediation scenarios, code, and processes to produce fit-for-purpose data.
Propose and gain consensus on technical solutions for data remediation, ensuring solutions are well-documented to meet regulatory standards.
Engage with key stakeholders across Corporate Banking and Credit Data Domains to resolve data quality and availability issues.
Lead content-driven data remediation projects, driving decisions on alternative data sources, external data, and logical derivations to fill critical data gaps.
Support the structural resolution of data quality issues, contributing to the client’s compliance with regulatory requirements such as the A-IRB license.
Present solutions and share insights with the stakeholders and your team to drive continuous improvement.


Over jou


Data analysis, data modelling: ability to construct data-set from source to desired cube.
SQL and Python (Pyspark).
Software engineering (CI/CD, unit testing, DTAP, OOP).
Stakeholder management.
Team cooperation and content leadership.
Knowledge of credit and/or Risk processes and databases.


We offer you the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment and you will also be part of an enthusiastic and motivated team. You get plenty of room for initiatives and there are plenty of opportunities for growth. We invite you to apply for this interesting position so that you can work with nationalities from all over the world and in an atmosphere in which all employees are valued.

Being mediated by Brunel means that you have a contract with Brunel. Not only do you have a contract, you are also guaranteed a great career! Our primary and secondary terms of employment are excellent.

Some examples are:


Tech savvy team of international colleagues.
Bonus opportunities.
Standard 26 vacation days.
8% vacation pay.
A salary up to 6000 EUR gross based on your experience.


Over ons

When you work for Brunel, you work in a company with a gigantic network in 45 countries around the world. Did you know that we have a lot of different nationalities at work in the Software development sector in the Netherlands? At the moment we are hiring a Data Scientist in the Netherlands. Which skills will you ad for this position?]]>

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Kom werken bij CloudNation, waar we de kracht van data en AI benutten om industrieën te innoveren en te transformeren. We zijn een dynamisch team van gedreven professionals, ondernemers en tech-enthousiastelingen die zich inzetten voor het leveren van baanbrekende oplossingen.




Functieomschrijving:

We zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde Machine Learning Engineer om ons snelgroeiende AI-team te versterken. Bij CloudNation helpen we onze klanten om hun weg te vinden in het complexe en snel evoluerende AI-landschap.




Het aanbod:

Bruto maandsalaris tussen de €4.000,- en €5.500,-

Bij hard werken hoort een passende beloning. Dat snappen we bij CloudNation goed. Daarom krijg je bij ons een 'rebel package' met de volgende perks:

The usual: Een goed salaris dat past bij je verantwoordelijkheden, skills en ervaring plus laptop en telefoon van de zaak. Je mag kiezen: MacBook, Windows, iPhone, Android.
Ook goed geregeld: Mobiliteitsbudget, pensioen, thuiswerkvergoeding, studiebudget.
Work hard, play harder: Je krijgt van ons 26 vakantiedagen + 1 extra per 6 maanden niet ziek (2 extra dus totaal 28), omdat we vrije tijd voor dingen waar je écht blij van wordt ook belangrijk vinden.
Bij CloudNation hanteren wij hybride werken: dat betekent een combinatie tussen werken op kantoor, bij de klant en thuiswerken. Workation is in goed overleg ook mogelijk.
Samenwerken en plezier hebben: AWS en Azure dagen op woensdag en maandag. Ook belangrijk: een grote keuken voorzien van alle gemakken om samen te lunchen. Vanaf 16.00
uur borreltijd!
Nog meer plezier: Elke laatste vrijdag van de maand houden we de Grote CloudNation Vrijmibo! Met snacks, drinken en zo veel mogelijk CloudNation rebel's aanwezig.
TGIF: Elke vrijdagochtend worden er een virtuele meetings gehouden m.b.t. Share & Inspire en Deep Dive. En de week wordt afgesloten met wederom borreltijd.
En veel meer: bedrijfsuitjes naar de sneeuw of Berlijn, tafelvoetbal, darten, gamen, om mee te spelen en vrij in te vullen, company funded, teambuilding activiteiten.




Belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheden:

Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van op Python gebaseerde back-enddiensten (FastAPI).
Betrokken zijn bij het bouwen en gebruiken van REST API's.
Samenwerken aan machine learning-projecten, inclusief het implementeren van modellen en het integreren van AI/ML-functionaliteiten.
Deelnemen aan de volledige ontwikkelingscyclus, inclusief ontwerp, codering, testen en productie-implementatie.
Werken in een teamomgeving om nieuwe ideeën te bedenken en bestaande processen te verbeteren.
Communiceren met klanten.




Gewenste vaardigheden:

Ervaring met frontend-ontwikkeling in React en TypeScript is een pluspunt.
Ervaring met data-engineering.
Bekendheid met Docker, microservices-architecturen en cloudomgevingen.
Kennis van Large Language Models (LLM's) en machine learning-frameworks.




Kwalificaties, jij hebt:

2-5 jaar ervaring en een achtergrond in software engineering (backend focus).
Ervaring met RAG/agentic applicaties
Ervaring met (web) engineering
ML/DS staat op tweede plek ten opzichte van de web engineering skill set
Een bachelor in informatica of aanverwante gebieden, of gelijkwaardige praktische ervaring.
Sterke probleemoplossende vaardigheden en het vermogen om samen te werken in een team.
Een ondernemende instelling en de bereidheid om verantwoordelijkheid te nemen voor je werk.
Het vermogen om snel nieuwe technologieën te begrijpen.
Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.




Onze stack is op dit moment:

Backend: Python (FastAPI) (belangrijk)
Azure, AWS, Docker, GitHub Actions
Frontend: TypeScript (React) (geen must, ervaring wel een plus)
Show more

Bruto maandsalaris tussen de €4.000,- en €5.500,-

Bij hard werken hoort een passende beloning. Dat snappen we bij CloudNation goed. Daarom krijg je bij ons een 'rebel package' met de volgende perks:

  • The usual: Een goed salaris dat past bij je verantwoordelijkheden, skills en ervaring plus laptop en telefoon van de zaak. Je mag kiezen: MacBook, Windows, iPhone, Android.
  • Ook goed geregeld: Mobiliteitsbudget, pensioen, thuiswerkvergoeding, studiebudget.
  • Work hard, play harder: Je krijgt van ons 26 vakantiedagen + 1 extra per 6 maanden niet ziek (2 extra dus totaal 28), omdat we vrije tijd voor dingen waar je écht blij van wordt ook belangrijk vinden.
  • Bij CloudNation hanteren wij hybride werken: dat betekent een combinatie tussen werken op kantoor, bij de klant en thuiswerken. Workation is in goed overleg ook mogelijk.
  • Samenwerken en plezier hebben: AWS en Azure dagen op woensdag en maandag. Ook belangrijk: een grote keuken voorzien van alle gemakken om samen te lunchen. Vanaf 16.00
  • uur borreltijd!
  • Nog meer plezier: Elke laatste vrijdag van de maand houden we de Grote CloudNation Vrijmibo! Met snacks, drinken en zo veel mogelijk CloudNation rebel's aanwezig.
  • TGIF: Elke vrijdagochtend worden er een virtuele meetings gehouden m.b.t. Share & Inspire en Deep Dive. En de week wordt afgesloten met wederom borreltijd.
  • En veel meer: bedrijfsuitjes naar de sneeuw of Berlijn, tafelvoetbal, darten, gamen, om mee te spelen en vrij in te vullen, company funded, teambuilding activiteiten.


Belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheden:

  • Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van op Python gebaseerde back-enddiensten (FastAPI).
  • Betrokken zijn bij het bouwen en gebruiken van REST API's.
  • Samenwerken aan machine learning-projecten, inclusief het implementeren van modellen en het integreren van AI/ML-functionaliteiten.
  • Deelnemen aan de volledige ontwikkelingscyclus, inclusief ontwerp, codering, testen en productie-implementatie.
  • Werken in een teamomgeving om nieuwe ideeën te bedenken en bestaande processen te verbeteren.
  • Communiceren met klanten.


Gewenste vaardigheden:

  • Ervaring met frontend-ontwikkeling in React en TypeScript is een pluspunt.
  • Ervaring met data-engineering.
  • Bekendheid met Docker, microservices-architecturen en cloudomgevingen.
  • Kennis van Large Language Models (LLM's) en machine learning-frameworks.


Kwalificaties, jij hebt:

  • 2-5 jaar ervaring en een achtergrond in software engineering (backend focus).
  • Ervaring met RAG/agentic applicaties
  • Ervaring met (web) engineering
  • ML/DS staat op tweede plek ten opzichte van de web engineering skill set
  • Een bachelor in informatica of aanverwante gebieden, of gelijkwaardige praktische ervaring.
  • Sterke probleemoplossende vaardigheden en het vermogen om samen te werken in een team.
  • Een ondernemende instelling en de bereidheid om verantwoordelijkheid te nemen voor je werk.
  • Het vermogen om snel nieuwe technologieën te begrijpen.
  • Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.


Onze stack is op dit moment:

  • Backend: Python (FastAPI) (belangrijk)
  • Azure, AWS, Docker, GitHub Actions
  • Frontend: TypeScript (React) (geen must, ervaring wel een plus)

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer

Utrecht, Nederland

Tot 80k + benefits




-Dutch Speaking-




Ben jij een getalenteerde Machine Learning Engineer met een passie voor in productie brengen van models. Word lid van een dynamisch en zelforganiserend klein adviesbureau dat flexibiliteit, samenwerking en het leveren van hoogwaardige oplossingen voor predictive klanten.




Het Bedrijf

Sinds 2015 heeft ons kleine adviesbureau zich gevestigd als een gemeenschap van data-experts, sterke klantrelaties opgebouwd en innovatieve oplossingen geleverd.




De Rol

Als Machine Learning Engineer zul je:

Samenwerken met klanten om hun behoeften te begrijpen en op maat gemaakte datasolutions te leveren.
Aan de slag gaan met het in productie brengen van modellen en end-to-end projecten.
Bouwen van data platforms en data infrastructure.
Samenwerken met een team van experts en deelnemen aan kennisdelingssessies elke vrijdag.




Ervaring

4+ jaar ervaring in data science, met een focus op voorspellende modellering en forecasting.
Vaardigheid in Python, PyTorch, Keras en Databricks.
Nederlands sprekend




Benefits

Een ondersteunende en collaboratieve werkomgeving.
Regelmatige kennisdelingssessies elke vrijdag.
Sociale evenementen om teamverbindingen te versterken.
Competitieve reisvoordelen.
Mogelijkheid om te werken met een gerenommeerd merk en een sterke klantenbasis.
Hybride werkbeleid met 2-3 dagen op kantoor en flexibiliteit op basis van projectvereisten.
Een competitief salarispakket (inclusief Bonus)




Klaar om spannende uitdagingen aan te gaan en te werken met een divers klantenbestand? Solliciteer via de knop op deze pagina en stuur je CV naar Elisabeth Oudman.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
As a senior MLOps engineer, you will be working with the platform team as well as the Data science team. You will translate the technical needs of the Data science team to appropriate templates that fit within our generalized platform. Moreover, you will consult the Platform team on best practices when it comes to MLOps and its implementation. With each other Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. With a team of 7 data scientists, machine learning engineers, and cloud engineers you shape the way we do business within the organization. As a team, we leverage data through advanced analytics to deliver data-driven tools to our stakeholders in the specific business domain. Our data science products facilitate evidence-based agile strategic and tactical decision-making. In the past the team worked on: * Measuring our client's sustainability level with natural language processing and web scraping algorithm; * Shaping the new Road Map for our Retention Strategy with AI algorithms and recommendations for retention campaigns; * Helping our portfolio management team to make the best strategic decisions based on a portfolio simulation tool or forecasting future portfolio inflow; * Helping on setting acceptance strategy for new applications based on a simulation tool powered by AI evolution strategy algorithm.With your skills and responsibilities Responsibilities for AI Models (MARS, Gen AI & New use cases): * IT Security & Compliance: Implement security concerns related to ML systems based on Rabobank standards that have been designed with close collaboration with the Solution architect and IT teams; * Templates: Create and manage reusable deployment templates for ML models; * Support Deployments: Collaborate with data scientists during model deployment; * Maintenance: Maintain ML models in production (i.e. retraining, monitoring health and ensuring service availability); * CI/CD Implementation & Orchestration: Implement continuous integration and continuous deployment pipelines and streamline deployment workflows; * Responsible for batch, real-time and GenAI model deployments; * Tech Stack Alignment: Provide support in aligning the tech stack with architectural requirements in collaboration with Solution architects and IT4IT engineers.

Qualifications:
Technical Skills:
* DBX & Databricks & Azure Tech Stack: Proficiency in these platforms and integrations;
* Architecture Affinity: Understanding of systems architecture;
* DevOps: Experience with DevOps practices;
* Security Affinity/Basics: Awareness of security best practices;
* Python: Ability to write and maintain Python code;
* Deployment Track Record: Demonstrated success in deploying ML models to production environments, both real time and batch based.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
MLOps Engineer / AI Engineer - Leading Investment Bank - The Hague - Hybrid remote - GenAI (RE-OPENED + URGENT ! ! !)




Together with the Director of Data Analytics of a leading Investment Bank in The Hague, I'm looking for an MLOps Engineer / Machine Learning / AI Engineer, with a focus on pushing models in production (MLOps).




This is a key position in a new small dedicated Advanced Analytics team, where you can take a pivotal role in pushing risk & ML Models into production:




Your responsibilities:

Automate, and maintain ML models using Databricks, PYTHON, AzureML and MATLAB
Collaborate with data scientists and business stakeholders to ensure ML & AI models are production-ready and meet performance standards - advise them with your MLOps knowledge!
Provide and implement innovative solutions to automate the production of AI and ML models for Predictive AI in the Risk Department
Work on GenAI and predictive modelling/AI




Teck Stack: Python, MLOps, AzureML, DataBricks, MATLAB, GUI, DevOps, Software Engineering, ETL, CICD, GenAI, PredictiveAI




Your profile:

The ideal candidate has 2/3 years experience within MLOps
Proficient in Python and designing, developing and maintaining ML models (Machine Learning models)
You've worked with Databricks, Python, AzureML, Azure Factory
Exposure to MATLAB




Environment: greenfield Data Analytics department & Centre of Expertise. They focus on implementing GenAI + Predictive AI. This department holds the largest budget of the whole bank; Innovation and Investment is at its core.




The bank offers great benefits:

32 (!!) holidays
Hyrid working from The Hague office
Best pension in the Netherlands (+30% of annual salary)
Excellent Learning & Development programs
NS Business card 1st Class




Are you a Medior - Senior Machine Learning or Data Science Engineer / Software Engineer or Data Engineer, even an AI Engineer - with experience within MLOps?




Please apply!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you looking for a job with impact, where your expertise and skills are actually driving strategic decisions? Come and join us at KLM, as we embark on an ambitious journey to transform the airline industry thanks to data and AI. Re-inventing our client’s shopping experience, designing new offers or changing the way we interact with our clients on all platforms and around the world are some example of the many exciting projects laying ahead of us, where data and AI unlock new opportunities. At KLM, we are seeking top tier Data Scientist professionals who are self-motivated, detail oriented and eager to learn, to help us through our transformation in a highly competitive environment.Come join us!

What will you do?


Interact with a broad range of stakeholders across Air France and KLM organization to get a proper understanding of our business processes, policies, etc. and how it translates into a better experience for our client and strategic goals for Air France and KLM.
Research and select (1) most relevant statistical / predictive approach and (2) data sources to address the goals and challenges.
Design and implement descriptive, predictive analytics, forecasting, and causal inference models, while controlling for quality of your results and potential limits or bias.
Explain approach and convey complex analysis results clearly to various types of stakeholders, both technical and non-technical, at operational or executive level.
Provide a detailed documentation of your work to ensure continuity, reusability and knowledge sharing in the Air France and KLM community of data scientists.
Partner with teams across Air France and KLM organization to explore, identify and anticipate opportunities in the application of Data Science when valuable for our clients and for our business goals.
Contribute to developing data science expertise throughout the organization, by sharing knowledge with a pedagogical approach and demonstrating its concrete benefits.
Take part in Air France and KLM’s major data transformation projects, e.g. migration to our Cloud Platform, training and up-skilling for data experts, data management initiatives.
Act as a mentor and coach for your peers, proactively educating and upskilling them, and stay current with the latest advances in data science.


Where do you land?

You will join one of the founding entity leveraging data for Air France and KLM and for our clients: our Commercial Data Office (CDO).At both Air France and KLM, Commercial and Marketing domains have been a pioneers in leveraging data to improve our competitiveness and deliver outstanding experience for our clients.Founded a decade ago, Commercial Data Office (CDO) has been a key accelerator to serve this ambition, initially being the founder of our 360° overview of client’s interactions and experience on all touch points (digital, call center, airport, on board). Since then, CDO has extended its purpose to other essential functions for our data transformation, such as Data Governance & Data Management, Advanced Analytics of customer behavior and satisfaction, and soon an enhanced 360° overview of client’s shopping experience.Via those achievements, CDO has brought to the next level our ability to deliver value thanks to data.As a data scientist, you will be hired into CDO department, integrated into its Commercial Data Analytics (CDA) team, at the front line to serve the ambition of Air France and KLM Commercial & Marketing domains through data science.In CDA team, you will be encouraged to research the best approach for our stakeholders, test and learn in a pragmatic manner to achieve concrete results and facilitate strategic decisions, but also teach others and, when it comes to data, be a mentor for a wide range of stakeholders, whether a data expert or an executive leader. You will be working in a hybrid manner, partly from home and from the KLM HQ in Amstelveen. Office days are flexible while ensuring interactions with the rest of the team.You will also join our talented and enthusiastic KLM Data Science Community and get to meet data scientists working for domains across Air France and KLM organization (Engineering & Maintenance, Operations, Crew, etc.).

Your profile

Required Qualifications Are


M.Sc in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field.
A minimum of 3 years of experience in:
using statistical computing languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) and manipulating structured and unstructured data
applying statistical techniques e.g. causal inference, multi-variate analysis, linear regression models & ANOVA, principal component analysis, factor analysis, clustering, etc.
drawing insights from large data sets and visualizing complex data in popular frameworks or platforms


We have found that people who match the following requirements are the ones who fit us best:


Consulting experience or proven experience explaining mathematical approach and results to non-expert stakeholders.
Experience working for transport industry and/or any domains related to Customer Experience and Commercial strategy (Marketing, Customer Service, Loyalty, Sales, etc.) is a strong plus.
A true passionate about causal inference and econometrics, with demonstrated experience in the field.
Demonstrated ability to be rigorous and detail-oriented when manipulating data, willingness to dig deep into problems to support bug fixing.
Ability to deliver meaningful insights and striking visualization of complex data.
Both eager to brainstorm and research on state-of-the-art data science, as well as eager to share knowledge with others; Experience mentoring / coaching other data scientists is a plus.
Pragmatic, solution oriented and result driven. Passionate about the concrete impacts on customer journey and KLM business goals.
Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal; Proven interpersonal, analytical, communication, and presentation skills, in particular the ability to communicate complex findings in a simple manner.
Highly credible in organizational, time management, decision making and problem-solving skills.
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum SDLC, preferably using Google Cloud Platform and GitHub, or in other open-source data science technologies (e.g. Spark) is a plus.


You may not check every box, or your experience may look a little different from what we have outlined, but if you think you are a fast-learner and can bring value as a data scientist at KLM, we encourage you to apply!

What Do We Offer


A gross salary between €4.988,38 and € € 7.126,25 per month;
Plenty of scope for personal development and great advancement opportunities;
An excellent pension scheme and 8% holiday allowance;
A year-end bonus of 8.33%;
A profit-sharing scheme, up to 20%;
25 leave days and 5 extra days off;
7 extra days off if you work irregular shifts;
Substantial discount on airfare (when you have been employed for at least 6 months);
A travel expense scheme and free use of the bus network around Schiphol;
If your job allows it: working from home and up to 8 weeks working from abroad (EU and Caribbean);
2% development budget;


Ready for your next destination?

Don’t wait any longer and apply for this function before the final boarding call on 09/18/2024! A motivation letter is no longer required; we will simply ask you a couple of questions during your online application. Within two weeks, you will receive a message from us. Your application procedure consists of two interviews and –possibly- an assessment and security research.Did you know that according to research, women are less likely to apply than men when they don't meet all the job requirements? What a shame. Because, in our view, 'the perfect candidate' is a myth. So, if you have the drive to grow in aspects of this role, we look forward to your application.A file check (for ex-KLM-employees) and/or a reference check can be part of the application procedure. By applying for this vacancy you consent to these checks.

  • A profit-sharing scheme, up to 20%;
  • 25 leave days and 5 extra days off;
  • 7 extra days off if you work irregular shifts;
  • Substantial discount on airfare (when you have been employed for at least 6 months);
  • A travel expense scheme and free use of the bus network around Schiphol;
  • If your job allows it: working from home and up to 8 weeks working from abroad (EU and Caribbean);
  • 2% development budget;

Ready for your next destination?

Don’t wait any longer and apply for this function before the final boarding call on 09/18/2024! A motivation letter is no longer required; we will simply ask you a couple of questions during your online application. Within two weeks, you will receive a message from us. Your application procedure consists of two interviews and –possibly- an assessment and security research.Did you know that according to research, women are less likely to apply than men when they don't meet all the job requirements? What a shame. Because, in our view, 'the perfect candidate' is a myth. So, if you have the drive to grow in aspects of this role, we look forward to your application.A file check (for ex-KLM-employees) and/or a reference check can be part of the application procedure. By applying for this vacancy you consent to these checks.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Ben jij gepassioneerd over het verleggen van de grenzen van machine learning? Heb jij ervaring in cloudplatformen, zoals Azure. Deze klant is op zoek naar getalenteerde individuen die hun dynamische en groeiende team komt te versterken.




Over de functie

Bij deze organisatie speel je een cruciale rol in het succesvol integreren van onze machine learning-toepassingen in productiesoftware. Daarnaast draag je bij aan het bevorderen van de onderzoeksbasis, het ontwikkelen van toekomstige prototypes en het verbeteren van de continue integratieprocessen




Wat ga je doen?

Ontwerpen en implementeren van schaalbare, gedistribueerde machine learning-systemen op cloudplatforms (momenteel Azure).
Beheren van cloudgebaseerde implementaties voor machine learning-toepassingen, inclusief het monitoren van hun gezondheid en het optimaliseren van prestaties.
Zorgen voor de betrouwbaarheid, beveiliging en efficiëntie van onze machine learning-oplossingen in de cloudomgeving.
Samenwerken met cross-functionele teams om cloudservices te integreren in ons software-ecosysteem.
Helpen bij het verder automatiseren van ons continue integratieproces voor kwaliteitsborging en het identificeren van potentiële problemen.
Het team versterken door mentoring en het demonstreren van de overgang naar een cloud-first infrastructuur en het bevorderen van best practices in systeemontwerp.
Debuggen, testen en oplossen van technische problemen met betrekking tot de machine learning-toepassing.







Over de organisatie

Onze klant is een toonaangevend bedrijf op het gebied van voorraadbeheer en optimalisatie. Zij stellen hun klanten in staat om weloverwogen beslissingen te nemen door gebruik te maken van automatisering, data-inzichten en geavanceerde modelleringstechnieken. Naast de continue ontwikkeling hanteren ze state-of-the-art data science en machine learning-methodologieën om te integreren en te werken aan een volledig geautomatiseerde supply chain.







Wie ben jij

Uitgebreide ervaring met cloudplatforms, bij voorkeur Azure.
Inzicht in cloudarchitectuur, gedistribueerde systemen, beveiligingspraktijken en gerelateerde kostenbeheer.
Ervaring met het implementeren en beheren van machine learning-toepassingen in een cloudomgeving.
Ervaring met automatisering (tools zoals command-line scripting, Docker, Kubernetes, Airflow, GitHub Actions, etc.).
Vertrouwd met MLOps en CI/CD-pijplijnen.
Minimaal 4 jaar relevante ervaring.
Ervaren Python-gebruiker.
Interesse in supply chain en voorraadbeheer.
Goede schrijf- en verbale vaardigheden.
Een teamspeler en leergierig.
Een hands-on mentaliteit.







Wat bieden we je

Salaris tot €71.000 per jaar (40 uur)
Flexibel werkbeleid. Mogelijkheid om vier dagen in de week thuis te werken
Werken in een diverse Artificial Intelligence team
Uitstekend pakket aan secundaire voorwaarden
Persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling in een groeiend bedrijf
Werken in een leuke, informele en internationale werkomgeving
Veel vrijheid en ruimte op eigen ideeën te implementeren







Interesse?

Herken jij jezelf in deze beschrijving en ben je klaar voor de volgende stap in je carrière? Neem dan contact op met Tim




t.brillenburg@elevationpartners.nl




Stuur je een recent CV mee, zodat we direct kunnen zien of jouw ervaring past bij het profiel.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
*ML Engineer*

Amsterdam

Hybrid







About

Their mission is to share their passion for music videos with the world and invite people to experience music beyond listening: to see your music. Based in Amsterdam, the comapany now reaches 100 million households across multiple territories through linear networks, interactive TV apps, and on-demand streaming services. They revolutionize the way audiences experience music videos by allowing viewers to search, like, and skip through the entire catalogue, enjoy channels curated by their team of music experts, and create their own channels using the unique Mixer feature. With a full music video catalogue from major and top independent music labels, they work every day to expand our offerings.




About the Role

They are looking for a passionate Mid+/Senior Python Engineer in the Data/ML domain to join the team. You will be responsible for the machine learning services in production, including software and service design/development, monitoring, practical MLOps, performance, and architecture. You will work closely with Data Science, Data Analytics, Backend Engineering teams, and other technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Responsibilities

Design, develop, and scale new/existing data and machine learning pipelines (ETLs, feature stores, productize model training and serving), data products, and services.
Resolve problems with end-to-end ownership of machine learning and data preparation/transformation pipelines.
Assist colleagues with technical challenges.
Design, test, install, and maintain highly scalable and data-intensive systems.
Review, maintain, refactor, and extend distributed systems in production. Support other teams for usage and integration with those systems.
Maintain the technical excellence of the data, ML, and software engineering practices.
Work on shared libraries, infrastructure, and building blocks within the monorepo space.
Collaborate with the Product Manager and other stakeholders, participating in forming, prioritizing, and executing the data-intensive products backlog.




Job Requirements

Broad interest and experience within ML/Data domains.
Proven professional experience as a Software Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, or Data Engineer, working with systems and data infrastructure at scale.
Experience with crafting and building large-scale data pipelines in distributed environments with technologies such as Kafka, ClickHouse, Elastic, Cassandra, Spark/PySpark, or similar.
Experience with data streams processing tools and concepts.
Experience optimizing ML models, services, pipelines, and procedures for performance, cost, and usability.
Knowledge of main architecture models and concepts like replication, sharding, consistency, horizontal and vertical scaling, idempotency.
Experience with MLOps practices, building and deploying ML models and data pipelines.
Preferably a university degree in Software Engineering or other relevant fields or comparable work experience.
Experience with data pipeline orchestrators such as AirFlow, Kubeflow, Dagster, or similar.
Excellent analytical and communication skills.
Experience in operationalizing recommender systems is a plus.




Tech Stack:

Languages: Python 3 (Pandas, Polars, NumPy, Pydantic), Scala (cats, cats-effect, fs2)
Technologies: Kafka, ClickHouse, PostgreSQL, Redis, MongoDB, Memgraph, GCP Buckets, MLFlow, Prometheus
Tools: Bazel, Docker, Kubernetes, Airflow, GCP
Platforms: GitHub, CircleCI, Ansible, Superset, Grafana, and many other mostly open-source technologies




They ensure you’re taken care of by providing you the opportunity to develop your career in a young, fast-growing, and international company. They offer a challenging work environment with a lot of autonomy, flexible working hours, and no two days being the same.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer

The Netherlands

Salary: Up to 80,000




Looking for an ML specialist, who is keen to work on some of the most cutting-edge projects within Ai. Join a exciting start up operating in the music industry, using Machine Learning to support customer needs and optimize business decisions.




THE COMPANY

This is a company that's aim is to build insight into business decisions across the globe, you will be joining a large Machine Learning team, working and taking ownership of large-scale projects. They are specialising in the fintech space for engineering.




THE ROLE

Machine Learning Engineer, where you will look at building software products for a number of clients: You will be responsible for the design, initial development, and evaluation of ML solutions:

You will keep up to date with emerging research and trends
You will contribute to the wider data science vision and product roadmap
Actively join in, in code reviews and architectural discussions
Work closely with the engineering teams
You will have the chance to do your own independent research, also attend conferences
Build models to drive business values
Enhance products using ML
Extract information using ML to understand what matters to employees




YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Practical experience with mentoring junior members
Experience with survey data
Experience with AWS, Tensorflow and Python Data Science stack
Also knowledge of Git, Kubernetes, Docker, Jenkins
Experience building complex NLP models
Good communication skills




SALARY AND BENEFITS

Up to 80,000
Flexible working
Pension scheme
+ many more




HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Charlotte York via the apply link on this page

Title: Internship: Data Science
Place: Alphen aan den Rijn, South Holland, Netherlands
Description:
Avery Dennison Corporation (NYSE: AVY) is a global materials science and digital identification solutions company that provides a wide range of branding and information solutions that optimize labor and supply chain efficiency, reduce waste, advance sustainability, circularity and transparency, and better connect brands and consumers. Our products and solutions include labeling and functional materials, radio frequency identification (RFID) inlays and tags, software applications that connect the physical and digital, and a variety of products and solutions that enhance branded packaging and carry or display information that improves the customer experience. Serving an array of industries worldwide — including home and personal care, apparel, general retail, e-commerce, logistics, food and grocery, pharmaceuticals and automotive — we employ approximately 35,000 employees in more than 50 countries. Our reported sales in 2023 were $8.4 billion. Learn more at www.averydennison.com.


Avery Dennison is an equal opportunity employer.


Please let us know if we can support you with reasonable accommodations throughout the application process by contacting our team via Requestaccomodation@eu.averydennison.com.




Job Description



Do you want to put your engineering and analytical skills into practice in a diverse and global manufacturing company?


As a Data Science Intern, you will be responsible for improving and validating our predictive model. You will also collect new data, specifically viscosity measurements of PVC organosols with different formulations. These measurements are conducted in the lab and do not require prior experience in laboratory work. Once collected, you will preprocess the data and integrate it into the machine learning model. You will also re-train the model to enhance its accuracy and performance. Additionally, you will be responsible for creating an user interface and ensuring a smooth implementation of the model in the production area. This role offers a great opportunity to apply advanced machine learning techniques and data analytics in a practical setting, contributing to the optimisation of our production processes.


Your main responsibilities will be:


Collect viscosity measurements of PVC organosols
Preprocess and integrate collected data into the machine learning model
Retrain the predictive model to improve its accuracy and performance
Develop and implement an user interface for the model
Ensure smooth integration of the model in the production area
Monitor and maintain the performance of the model (prepare)

The preferred start date is 1st October 2024 or earlier. The ideal candidate is available 4 to 5 days a week for 6 months. The location of the position is our site in Alphen aan den Rijn. This is a hands-on internship experience which involves lots of lab work and requires working from the site physically.




Qualifications



What kind of candidate are we looking for?


Currently following a Bachelor or Master degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or related field
Advanced understanding of machine learning algorithms and techniques
Proficiency in Python and familiarity in relevant libraries
Understanding of Chemistry or Chemical Engineering is a plus
Someone with good communication skills in English
Someone who is independent and can lead their own projects


Additional Information



Our offer


550 euros per month compensation on a full-time basis
Commuting allowance (if applicable)
Specific training offerings during your internship to support your development
Team-oriented and highly international environment, in which you get responsibility and the possibility to test your talents

Important: Only applications in English will be considered! Applicants need to be enrolled at a Dutch university for the whole duration of the internship.


----


Note: We do not accept unsolicited referrals or resumes from any source other than directly from candidates using their personal email addresses.


Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer

Up to €80,000

Amsterdam




THE COMPANY

A leading Media Company in Amsterdam is revolutionising how people engage with their services. Their innovative platforms reach millions of households globally. Machine Learning is at the core of the services and product, and your work will have a big impact on customer experiences and enjoyment.




THE ROLE

The company is seeking a skilled Machine Learning Engineer with a passion for best-practice software engineering. In this role, you will collaborate with the existing ML team to put machine learning services in production. Your focus will be on designing, developing, and optimizing software and services, as well as ensuring smooth operations through MLOps practices.




Some of the exciting machine learning models you’ll be working with include recommendation systems, ad optimization algorithms, and content moderation models.




You will be working with a cutting-edge, open-source tech-stack, including real-time streaming in Kafka, Distributed Computing, MonoRepo, Prometheus and more.




RESPONSIBILITIES

Developing ETL pipelines for data processing, batch predictions, and real-time model serving.
Collaborating with the Data Science team to integrate ML services with other engineering teams.
Supporting and optimizing existing machine learning services and data pipelines.
Contributing to the design and implementation of new features, continuously driving innovation.




YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

To excel in this role, you will need:

Proven experience as a Python Engineer or ML Engineer - either way, you will need excellent Python Software Engineering Skills.
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and experience deploying ML models in production environments.
Experience with MLOps practices and tools (e.g., MLFlow).
Strong analytical abilities and excellent communication skills.
A degree in Software Engineering or a related field, or equivalent professional experience.




THE BENEFITS

This role offers a unique opportunity to advance your career within a dynamic and rapidly growing international company. You’ll enjoy:

A challenging work environment with significant autonomy and flexible working hours.
A supportive team culture that values kindness, professionalism, and a positive attitude.
Perks like chef-prepared lunches, rooftop BBQs, and regular team events.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Coders Connect is excited to partner with a groundbreaking company driving the energy transition in the Netherlands. This innovative organization is harnessing cutting-edge technology to optimize real assets and batteries, creating immediate impact for both customers and society at large. They’re on a mission to build a sustainable future, and we’re helping them find a confident, independent Senior Data Scientist to lead the charge.




What You'll Be Doing:

Leading and growing the Data Science function within the business.
Taking existing algorithms to the next level through innovation and cloud deployment on AWS.
Applying your expertise in Time Series analysis while working hands-on with Python, SQL, and advanced technologies such as Pytorch and Tensorflow.
Implementing data models that deliver actionable insights to drive business value and accelerate societal impact.




Requirements:

5+ years of experience in Data Science, with strong Python and SQL skills.
Expertise in Time Series analysis with a solid mathematical foundation.
Cloud deployment experience using AWS.
An independent, curious problem-solver who thrives on ownership and enjoys implementing innovative models.
While experience in the energy sector is a plus, it’s not a must.




Benefits:

Be at the heart of the energy transition, working on projects that have an immediate and tangible real-world impact.
Shape the future of the Data Science department with the freedom to implement your ideas and make a direct contribution to the company’s growth.
Join a close-knit team, working alongside a CTO, three developers, and a part-time Data Scientist, all committed to advancing technology in this rapidly growing sector.
Hybrid work environment in the vibrant city of Utrecht.
Show more
HTML:
Coders Connect is excited to partner with a groundbreaking company driving the energy transition in the Netherlands. This innovative organization is harnessing cutting-edge technology to optimize real assets and batteries, creating immediate impact for both customers and society at large. They’re on a mission to build a sustainable future, and we’re helping them find a confident, independent Senior Data Scientist to lead the charge.


What You'll Be Doing:

  • Leading and growing the Data Science function within the business.
  • Taking existing algorithms to the next level through innovation and cloud deployment on AWS.
  • Applying your expertise in Time Series analysis while working hands-on with Python, SQL, and advanced technologies such as Pytorch and Tensorflow.
  • Implementing data models that deliver actionable insights to drive business value and accelerate societal impact.


Requirements:

  • 5+ years of experience in Data Science, with strong Python and SQL skills.
  • Expertise in Time Series analysis with a solid mathematical foundation.
  • Cloud deployment experience using AWS.
  • An independent, curious problem-solver who thrives on ownership and enjoys implementing innovative models.
  • While experience in the energy sector is a plus, it’s not a must.


Benefits:

  • Be at the heart of the energy transition, working on projects that have an immediate and tangible real-world impact.
  • Shape the future of the Data Science department with the freedom to implement your ideas and make a direct contribution to the company’s growth.
  • Join a close-knit team, working alongside a CTO, three developers, and a part-time Data Scientist, all committed to advancing technology in this rapidly growing sector.
  • Hybrid work environment in the vibrant city of Utrecht.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist / ML engineer / Amsterdam / Hybrid




A large enterprise customer of ours is undergoing a transformation specifically aimed at growth and marketing area. They are seeking a talented Data Scientist to come on board and offer their expertise in a brand new greenfield assignment amongst a multi-disciplinary teams







The purpose of this area is to create customer demand, engagement, and loyalty with the brand by amplifying the commercial offer and we need predictive modelling for marketing and growth!







You will need:




5+ years of Data Science experience at enterprise level
Predictive modelling, statistics and Machine learning experience
Python
BigQuery




Desirable:




LLM (Large language models)
Generative AI exposure







Details:




4 month initial contract - view to extend in January - (its a 2 year project)
Self employed rate €80 - 85 per hour / 40 hours a week
Payroll salary = €7000 - 8000 a month
1 day a week in Amsterdam / 4 days remote







Apply today for a further discussion!




Data Scientist / ML engineer / Amsterdam / Hybrid

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
LocationUtrecht, NetherlandsBusiness SectorAIContact emailJob ref23546Published20 days ago

We are seeking an experienced Data Scientist to join one of our clients in MedTech. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing data-driven insights, predictive models, and advanced analytics. You will collaborate closely with engineers and clinicians to translate data into actionable insights.

Responsibilities


Analyze large, complex healthcare datasets to identify trends and generate actionable insights.
Develop predictive models and algorithms to improve clinical decision-making and patient outcomes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data science solutions into medical devices and healthcare applications.
Ensure data quality, integrity, and security in compliance with healthcare standards.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in data science and apply them to healthcare challenges.



Qualifications


Proven experience as a Data Scientist, ideally within the healthcare or MedTech industry.
Strong proficiency in Python, R, SQL, and data visualization tools.
Expertise in statistical analysis, machine learning, and predictive modeling.
Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based data platforms.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Professional proficiency in English.



Can this be interesting for you or anyone you know? If so, please send Gabriel Andrade: g.andrade@panda-int.com, your number/CV ASAP and I'll give you a call. Interviews will start next week.
