Title: Senior Data Scientist (Analytics), Consumer
Description:
Job Description

About the Consumer Group

As the name Consumer Group implies, this group is responsible for building and developing Wolt’s consumer-facing products. The core mission is to master the user experience while scaling up the platform to enable delivering a mall in a pocket.

About The Consumer Data Science Team

Consumer Analytics team comprises a cross-section of Data Scientists (Analytics) and Analytics Engineers. We work closely with the Data Engineering team who help ensure we have the right platform to deliver our insights at scale. We partner with Product, Engineering, Design and Operations teams to guide measurement and tactical decision-making using advanced analytics as we expand the Wolt platform across the globe.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational and actionable data-driven experience that requires a good mix of technical and stakeholder engagement skills. When you join this team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, rather than just doing yet another analytics or data science role. Data Scientists at Wolt take ownership of the business outcomes.

If you enjoy finding patterns amidst the chaos, are excited to build from 0 to 1, and have experience using data science skills to solve business problems, we're looking for someone like you.

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland and Sweden. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in a Data Analytics or Data Science position.
Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent for product development (preferably consumer-facing).
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar.
Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach


Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!


Show more
HTML:
Job Description

About the Consumer Group

As the name Consumer Group implies, this group is responsible for building and developing Wolt’s consumer-facing products. The core mission is to master the user experience while scaling up the platform to enable delivering a mall in a pocket.

About The Consumer Data Science Team

Consumer Analytics team comprises a cross-section of Data Scientists (Analytics) and Analytics Engineers. We work closely with the Data Engineering team who help ensure we have the right platform to deliver our insights at scale. We partner with Product, Engineering, Design and Operations teams to guide measurement and tactical decision-making using advanced analytics as we expand the Wolt platform across the globe.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational and actionable data-driven experience that requires a good mix of technical and stakeholder engagement skills. When you join this team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, rather than just doing yet another analytics or data science role. Data Scientists at Wolt take ownership of the business outcomes.

If you enjoy finding patterns amidst the chaos, are excited to build from 0 to 1, and have experience using data science skills to solve business problems, we're looking for someone like you.

Our offering to you

  • The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
  • You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland and Sweden. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
  • You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.

Our humble expectations

  • Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • 4+ years of experience in a Data Analytics or Data Science position.
  • Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent for product development (preferably consumer-facing).
  • Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
  • Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar.
  • Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach

Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

Title: Data Scientist Consultant
Description:
Are you passionate about data and the business value it can create? Look no further - Data Edge is the place to be!




Our ambition is to create a leading consulting company in the intersection between Business development, Analytics and Data. In order to succeed with that we need great people that want constant learning, are curious, have high integrity and love teamwork. Above all, share our passion about creating lasting business value through data and analysis.




We who work at Data Edge have many years of experience in data, analysis and data-driven transformation from leading consulting and tech companies and know what is needed to realize business value through data. Our ambition is to be the given choice for organizations that need to bridge the gap between business and technology, from strategy to implementation.




At Data Edge, we strive to live by our values: Passion for Data, Integrity, and Teamwork.




What We Offer




The opportunity to be part of a team that is committed to developing within the field. We invest in our growth through initiatives such as internal knowledge sharing and participation in external seminars/events.
A diverse range of challenges, both with clients and within our own company development. You will be instrumental in building a company where you will have significant impact and involvement.
A clear niche and broad network that will ensure engaging and rewarding projects within the field.




What We Are Looking For




Below are some areas with concrete examples of the skills you need. The list does not cover all required skills, but it's impossible for one person to be an expert in everything.




Passion for Data and Analytics: You genuinely enjoy using data and analytics to solve real-world problems for our clients.
Business Understanding: You have a knack for understanding business problems, what drives business success, and have experience working in business development.
Experience: You have at least 3 years of employment as either a Data Scientist or a consultant in Data Science.
Analytical Skills: You have experience conducting a wide range of analyses of varying complexity across different industries and are eager to learn more.
Cloud Platforms: Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure.
Cloud Computing & Modern Engineering Practices: Knowledge of cloud computing and modern engineering practices (e.g., version control, CI/CD, and Docker).
Programming Skills: Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, SQL, and experience in working with applied machine learning and generative AI.
Data Visualization & Communication: Ability to visualize complex data and clearly communicate insights to clients, making it actionable for business users.
Location & Eligibility: You are based in Stockholm and legally eligible to work in Sweden.
Interest in Building the Company: We also hope that you are interested in continuing to build Data Edge!




If this sounds interesting to you, please reach out! In your application, we would love to hear about your strengths and how you fit the role, as well as areas where you’re looking to grow, given the above description. No one knows everything, but we constantly strive to develop our skills and remain humble about the breadth of expertise required to drive business value from data.

Title: Junior Python Systemutvecklare – Stockholm heltid
Description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag. www.modernera.se

För en kunds räkning söker vi nu en junior Python systemutvecklare. Vår kund levererar lösningar som gör att deras kunder kan öka förändringstakt och kvalitet i sina digitala tjänster. Företagets kunder finns främst bland teleoperatörer, offentlig sektor, bank och försäkring i Sverige och Norge. Företaget har funnits sedan 1999 och består idag av ett 50-tal medarbetare.

Du kommer att jobba i trevliga lokaler i centrala Stockholm. Det finns möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån.

Du kommer att arbeta i varierande projekt och stå inför intressanta utmaningar för att effektivisera företagets kunders tekniska vardag.

Du har:

Utbildning på kandidatnivå

Upp till 3 års erfarenhet inom utveckling

Backend programmering

CI/CD pipeline (som Jenkins, Bamboo, Tekton)

Versionshantering (som Git, SVN, BitBucket)

Meriterande:

Frontend programering (som TypeScript, react.js, Node.js, angular.js)

Arkitektur baserad på mikrotjänster

Docker

Kubernetes

Terraform

OpenShift Cloud (som AWS, Azure)

Python

Shell

C++

Configuration as code

Infrastructure as code

Du får:

Arbeta i utmanande projekt med teknik i framkant

Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling där certifieringar är en självklarhet

Vara en del av en stimulerande arbetsmiljö med högt i tak

Åka på spännande konferensresor med roliga aktiviteter

Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, pensionsersättning, ett ordentligt friskvårdsbidrag och andra generösa förmåner

Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund. Heltid. Provanställning som övergår i en tillsvidareanställning efter sex månader. Tillträde: omgående.

Ansök genom att skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Skriv ”Junior Python Systemutvecklare – Stockholm heltid” i ärenderaden.

Title: Data Scientist with a hands on approach | SEB, Solna
Description:
Do you want to be part of a team in the forefront of SEBs AI journey? Join the AIOps team to help build our scalable AI platform.

SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From COBOL to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!

About the role:

You will be part of a team of passionate data scientists and developers that develop and maintain scalable AI services. Today the team support many internal teams with our products, the most popular being our anomaly detection platform that gives insights on anomalies in our firewalls, APIs, app traffic, swish flows and more. Your responsibility will be development, maintenance, and security of our products, and to explore the future of AI products together with the team.

The team is at the forefront of development and we expect you to thrive in ambiguity; although the team has a very practical approach, complex and fuzzy requirements are more common than clearly defined customer expectations. We believe in development based on incremental steps toward solving complex problems since test-and-learn approaches work better than heads-down development.

Have you worked on a project in school or at home that you're proud of? Please share it with us in your application!

To thrive in this role, we believe you have:


Excellent problem-solving skills and a drive to find the best solutions for a given problem
Proficiency in SQL, R, Python, or other relevant programming languages
Familiarity with modern frameworks (e.g. Pytorch, Tensorflow) and deep learning techniques.
Experience working with NLP (e.g., seq2seq, sentence similarity, natural language inference)
Strong statistical and analytical skills, with a demonstrated ability to translate complex data into insights for consumers
Interest in the full stack and eager to learn how software engineering and data science meet to deliver AI products


What we offer:


Challenging, cutting-edge work
A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views
Agile and modern ways of working
Extensive training and learning opportunities
Remote working possibilities and flexible work schedule


Do you want to be part of SEB?

Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 20th of September 2024. If you have questions about the position, please contact Victor Giertta, team manager, at victor.giertta@seb.se , or Evelina Bornby-Keskitalo, Product Owner at evelina.bornby-keskitalo @seb.se.

Learn more about working at SEBhere : www.sebgroup.com/techcareers

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title: Data Scientist

Location: Stockholm, Sweden

We are seeking a talented Data Scientist to join our team in Stockholm, Sweden. Our client is a leading provider of audit, accounting, tax, and consulting services. With over 1000 employees across the country, they support businesses with a range of financial and strategic services to foster sustainable growth.

About the Role:

As a Data Scientist, you will play a crucial role in transforming unstructured data into actionable insights. You will be working extensively with Python and Azure functions, focusing on data engineering and application development. Our main application processes annual reports from clients, converting various types of data into a structured format.

With an internal network of IT professionals within the business, the Data Science team sits as a smaller close-knit group with currently 80% of the work focused on maintaining existing systems and 20% on new development. The goal is to shift to a more balanced workload, aiming for 50% maintenance and 50% new projects to ensure equal innovation.

Key Responsibilities:


Transforming unstructured data into structured formats.
Developing and maintaining applications using Python.
Working with Azure functions and other cloud services.
Implementing controls and ensuring data quality.
Supervising models in production and developing & deploying machine learning models.
Analyze and interpret complex data sets.
Work with Python, SQL, and version control systems like Git.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as development teams and other business units to drive business insights.
Maintain and enhance data processing systems.


Qualifications:


BSc or MSc (preferably M.Sc) in a relevant field.
At least 2 years of experience as a Data Scientist, Data Engineer, Software Engineer, or Machine Learning Engineer.
Proficiency in Python, git, and SQL.
At least 1-year experience with Azure, GCP, or AWS.
Experience with supervising models in production.


Preferred Skills:


Familiarity with Azure ML products (Form Recognizer, Cognitive Search, etc.).
Experience with Azure services (Storage, Serverless functions, Deploying ML Models).
Knowledge of MLOps and developing applications using LLMs.
Experience with ML Engineering and deploying both unsupervised and supervised ML models.
Proven track record in driving the development of ML applications.


Why Join Us?


High level of trust and responsibility.
Autonomy to design and implement your own solutions.
Opportunity to develop your own ideas and hold responsibility over the data science processes.
Broad role that encourages growth and learning with modern technology.
Collaborative and supportive work environment.
Significant impact on the internal workings of the company.
Excellent office location in a central area.


Their team values collaboration and innovation, providing a dynamic environment where you can grow and make a significant impact. They take pride in taking care of employees, offering a great office space in a central location and a supportive community. If you're passionate about data science and looking for a role that offers both responsibility and the opportunity to innovate, we would love to hear from you.

Title: Data Scientist - Payments
Description:
emagine is looking for an experienced Data Scientist to our client in Payment/Fintech domain.

Start: September/October

Duration. end of March 2025

Location: Hybrid setup from Stockholm

Job Description Summary:

The Global Analytics and Data Science team is seeking a Data Scientists to join us as exceptional problem solver with a passion for data insights and a relentless execution focus.

As a Data Scientist, you will spearhead our efforts to measure and enhance our payment products This role is central to our mission, offering you the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology in a fast-paced environment. You will lead the data science projects for the initiatives that optimize transaction success rates, directly impacting our ability to offer seamless payment solutions to millions of users worldwide.

Key Responsibilities:


Data Analysis and Decision Making: Utilize large, complex datasets to drive improvements in the Product. Employ advanced analytical and statistical techniques to identify trends, issues, and opportunities.
Strategic Influence: Develop and present insights and strategic recommendations to Product and Data Science leadership. Influence product direction and strategic decisions through data-driven insights.
Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product development, engineering, and marketing to implement data-driven improvements.
Innovation and Improvement: Lead initiatives to refine existing analytical processes and develop new approaches to business challenges. Promote a culture of continuous improvement and testing.


Required Skills and Qualifications:


5+ years of experience in analyzing multi-dimensional datasets and creating actionable business solutions.
Strong educational background with a Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Analytics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative discipline.
Relevant experience and expertise on A/B Experimentation setup and measurement.
Expertise in SQL, Excel, and visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau or Qlikview. Proficiency in a statistical programming language like R or Python is preferred.
Demonstrable experience with big data technologies such as Teradata, Hadoop/Hive, and BigQuery.
Knowledge of Python, Jupyter Notebooks, and SQL.
Exceptional communication skills to effectively articulate insights and influence cross-functional teams.
Prior experience in product analytics within a high-tech environment.


Personal Attributes:


A data-driven decision maker, passionate about solving complex problems using analytical solutions.
A self-starter who is motivated to take initiative and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
A fun-loving team player who brings energy and enthusiasm to the workplace.
Comfortable with ambiguity and uncertainty in a dynamic business landscape.

  • Strong educational background with a Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Analytics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative discipline.
  • Relevant experience and expertise on A/B Experimentation setup and measurement.
  • Expertise in SQL, Excel, and visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau or Qlikview. Proficiency in a statistical programming language like R or Python is preferred.
  • Demonstrable experience with big data technologies such as Teradata, Hadoop/Hive, and BigQuery.
  • Knowledge of Python, Jupyter Notebooks, and SQL.
  • Exceptional communication skills to effectively articulate insights and influence cross-functional teams.
  • Prior experience in product analytics within a high-tech environment.

Personal Attributes:

  • A data-driven decision maker, passionate about solving complex problems using analytical solutions.
  • A self-starter who is motivated to take initiative and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
  • A fun-loving team player who brings energy and enthusiasm to the workplace.
  • Comfortable with ambiguity and uncertainty in a dynamic business landscape.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer till Innovativt Internationellt Team
Description:
Industrin genomgår stora förändringar – omvandlingen till en smart och uppkopplad industri. Gå med i vår kunds internationella team och utveckla innovativa lösningar för hållbar och flexibel industriell produktion för kunder över hela världen.




OM TJÄNSTEN:

Teamet består av 25 personer som jobbar agilt och enligt SAFe-ramverket. Just nu utvecklar de en feature som analyserar moment i verktyg över tid, från lågt till högt moment. Modellen ska kunna identifiera avvikelser och ge förslag på fel i förebyggande syfte, samt ge löpande rekommendationer för att undvika dessa avvikelser. En viktig del av arbetet är att övervaka modellen, samla in feedback och träna om modellen vid behov. Cykeln är således: deploy, monitor, retrain.




ARBETSUPPGIFTER:

Som Machine Learning Engineer blir din uppgift att bygga pipelines för att verifiera att ML-modellen fungerar i produktion. Du kommer att:

Hämta data från kunder och validera samt testa modellen.
Om modellen inte fungerar, arbeta vidare med utvecklingen.
När modellen fungerar bra, gå vidare till nästa steg och deploya.




Du kommer att arbeta som en ML/Ops-ingenjör med fokus på pipelines och utveckling i Python.




VI SÖKER DIG SOM:

Har en teknisk akademisk examen, gärna en Master inom ett relevant område som tillämpad beräkningsvetenskap eller Machine Learning.
Ett par års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
Talar flytande engelska och trivs med att samarbeta både lokalt och globalt.




Som person är du nyfiken, social och flexibel. Du är bra på att kommunicera och samarbeta med andra i din omgivning.




OM KUNDFÖRETAGET:

Vår kund är ett globalt företag specialiserat på industriell teknik och lösningar. De har en lång historia av innovation och är en ledande aktör inom olika branscher, inklusive gruvdrift, anläggningsmaskiner, komprimerad luft och gas samt industriell produktion. Företaget fokuserar på att utveckla och tillverka högkvalitativa produkter och lösningar som är hållbara, effektiva och bidrar till kundernas framgång. Vår kund är känd för sitt starka kundfokus, etiska affärsprinciper och globala närvaro, med verksamhet i olika länder runt om i världen.




OM ANSTÄLLNINGEN:

Detta är ett konsultuppdrag, vilket innebär att du inledningsvis kommer att vara anställd av Friday. Ambitionen från både kundens och vår sida är att du efter 6–12 månader blir direktanställd hos kunden.




ÖVRIG INFO

Omfattning: Heltid
Start: Omgående
Placering: Stockholm/Nacka, med hybrid-möjligheter
Rekryteringsansvarig: Mattias Isik
Lön: Marknadsmässig




Ansök genom att klicka på länken nedan. Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt då vi gör löpande urval och annonsen kan stängas ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi går över till urvals- och intervjufasen.




OM FRIDAY

Genom att vara en partner till både våra kandidater och kunder strävar vi efter att hitta den bästa matchningen. Vi lär känna våra kunder och kandidater på riktigt! Förutom att säkerställa att kunskaps- och erfarenhetskrav matchar, lägger vi stor vikt vid samsyn kring värderingar och företagskultur som båda parter värdesätter.

Vår passion är att hjälpa människor till rätt roll, arbetsplats och sammanhang inom IT och teknik. Därför grundade vi Friday med ambition att hjälpa dig till jobbet som ger dig fredagskänslan – varje dag!

Vi riktar oss främst till dig som är i början av din karriär eller studerar vid högskola/universitet inom IT och Teknik.

Vår övertygelse är att människor uppnår sin fulla potential när man ser fram emot att gå till jobbet varje morgon. ”Friday – everyday”, hur låter det?

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Learning
Description:
We are looking for an entrepreneurial and business minded senior data scientist to join the band to help explore and execute on learning as a new opportunity for Spotify. It is a phenomenal role for someone who wants to work on a truly 0 to 1 project and have an impact on the company's growth trajectory!

As a data scientist in this team you’d partner with the full cross-functional team to help with research, data modeling and data-informed decision making related to building the product and driving impact for users, creators and the business. This is a fantastic opportunity to join our fast-paced team where you’ll get the chance to wear multiple hats and contribute to the product research and business analytics efforts to help craft and execute the product roadmap.

What You'll Do


Help build out the insights foundations that will allow us to gather conclusive evidence on the trajectory and viability of learning as an opportunity for Spotify. This includes instrumentation all the way through to analysis as well as understanding the learning space from multiple angles such as user, UX, content, marketing, creator and business perspectives to help inform decision making.
Develop business intelligence-, growth model- and product metrics framework.
Perform analysis on large sets of internal data to extract practical insights that will help drive product, platform and business decisions.
Design and conduct A/B tests to generate insights and drive impact across the entire learning product.
Build dashboards, data pipelines, and recurring reporting results, empowering business and product decision making
Develop models which power on- and off-platform promotion of learning based content
Help develop interest graph and content demand models for the content powering ML recommendations for users
Communicate data-driven insights and recommendations to key partners
Work closely and embedded with cross-functional team including engineering, product, design and business decision makers


Who You Are


You believe that Spotify can truly create an impact in the learning space and have a point of view on that.
You care end to end about the product, the implementation, the design, the creators, the business, and you are ready to wear multiple hats to achieve your goals.
You have experience in a data science role in a related field and expertise in science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, or similar quantitative subject area.
You have experience with business intelligence, product analytics and complex data-driven decision making.
You have broad experience performing analysis with large datasets and strong understanding of experimentation, statistics and machine learning for decision making.
You value cross-disciplinary work and understand how to match qualitative research with your quantitative analysis.
You take pride in your ability to identify and solve complex, unfamiliar problems, and present them to the rest of the team.
You have a growth mindset, are curious and not afraid to be experimental. You share your ideas and continuously improve yourself and the team around you.
You have excellent skills across the data science stack including Python, SQL and visualization tools (we primarily use Jupyter notebooks, BigQuery and Tableau)


Where You'll Be


The team is distributed across the CET region with most people located in Stockholm and London.


#JobSite-Main-DataResearchAndInsights

#JobSite-Sub-DataScience

#HireRight Sweden Package

Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

Title: Data Scientist - Data Driven Services Industry 5.0
Description:
Work at the heart of the Industry 5.0 transformation – the integration of artificial intelligence, robotics and the human factors of manufacturing! We are looking for a highly motivated Data Scientist who loves exploring data and based on new insights help build our next generation SaaS products.
Our systems empower industry users to control their assembly processes and create world class products. The solutions we develop are used to improve efficiency, quality, safety, speed, usability, ergonomics, and environmental performance.

Your role

Your focus is on research and technology activities in the early phase. This offers a lot of freedom for you when it comes to data exploration and give you a large possibility to impact the services our system offers. When you have finished reading this advert, approximately 22.000.000 new datapoints have been inserted into the research environment accessible for you. In this role, you’ll enjoy the freedom to work independently and with confidence, while also having the opportunity to learn and master the relevant domain knowledge.
Mission


Find business cases and customer value using machine learning, statistics and/or other methods
Present and visualize insights to stakeholders using story telling
Collaborate cross-functionally with software engineers, hardware engineers, product owners and product managers to implement scalable solutions
Track, evaluate and evolve models and services



Our environment: Microsoft Azure platform - Databricks and PySpark, Power BI, GIT etc.
You report to Team Manager Data Driven Services R&D Jörgen Maass.

City: Sickla (Nacka, Stockholm). We have a hybrid workplace model (60/40), combining the best of remote work and in-person collaboration.

You will need


A bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science/mathematics or related technical discipline
Knowledge in machine learning and statistics
Programming skills in Phyton
Experience in SQL and cloud computing
Communication skills
Fluency in English



We offer you

At Atlas Copco, we have a friendly atmosphere and a culture known for respectful interaction and ethical behavior. We value personal development and wellbeing, and we are proud of how we help and support each other. We offer opportunities to see your ideas realized and make an impact. As part of the Atlas Copco Group, you have access to global job opportunities.
You are welcome to contact recruiting manager Jörgen Maass, [email protected] , for more information.
Application: Please send us your CV including information about your expectations for your next job. We are looking forward to your application via our job site!

Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice

Bright ideas come from all of us. The more unique perspectives we embrace, the more innovative we are. Together we build a culture where difference is valued and we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist | SEB Kort, Stockholm
Description:
Brinner du för analysområdet? Gillar du data mining, modeller och analytics? Vi söker dig som vill vara en bidragande kraft i att göra SEB mer datadrivet!

SEB är en ledande nordeuropeisk koncern för finansiella tjänster med internationellt perspektiv och samtidigt en av Nordens största IT-arbetsgivare. Bankväsendet förändras snabbt och vi är stolta över vår entreprenörsanda och innovationskraft.

Finansiell kunskap, teknik och digitala lösningar är kärnan i SEB:s affär. Våra medarbetare inom IT och Tech arbetar hårt för att framtidssäkra SEB:s digitala arkitektur och produkter för att fortsatt leverera service i världsklass till våra kunder. Vill du vara en del av SEB?

Om rollen

Du kommer vara del av teamet Data & Analytics på SEB Kort. Teamet arbetar tillsammans med många interna intressenter för att säkerställa att datadrivna beslut kan fattas på såväl operativ som strategisk nivå i företaget. Adhoc analys, visualisering av data och prediktiv modellering är exempel på några arbetsuppgifter och metoder som förekommer i arbetet, ingen dag är den andra lik!

Som en Data Scientist kommer du att arbeta med:


Utveckling av prediktiva modeller
Machine learning och AI
Utveckling av dashboards, främst i Tableau
Proaktivt analysarbete på befintlig kundbas
Support till management och andra intressenter med beslutsstöd


Vi söker dig som

Du som söker behöver tycka om att jobba i olika team, både med kollegor som har liknande arbetsuppgifter, men även med kollegor som har annan kompetens och bakgrund. Du har en positiv inställning, är flexibel och ansvarstagande. Nyfikenhet och god kommunikationsförmåga är viktiga framgångsfaktorer!

Utöver ovan ser vi att du har:


Eftergymnasial examen inom statistik, matematik eller IT
Flerårig erfarenhet av att jobba med prediktiv modellering
Stor erfarenhet av Machine Learning och därtill relevanta verktyg och språk (tex. Tensorflow, Python)
Mycket goda kunskaper i SAS, SPSS, eller motsvarande
Goda kunskaper i engelska och svenska


Våra erbjudande till dig


Du kommer få ett roligt, omväxlande och utvecklande arbete i en vänlig och välkomnande kultur.
Du kommer vara delaktig i att hjälpa SEB och SEB Kort att blir än mer datadrivna.


Redo att ta nästa steg i din karriärresa?

Välkommen till vår inkluderande kultur där våra gemensamma värderingar inspirerar och lyfter vårt team. Vi värdesätter mångfald och strävar efter att alla medarbetare ska känna sig sedda, hörda och uppskattade.

Bifoga ditt CV och ett personligt brev där du beskriver dig själv och vad du kan bidra med. Vi gör urvalet löpande. Skicka gärna in din ansökan idag, men senast 22a september 2024. Om du har frågor om rollen, vänligen kontakta Johan Morling, Head of Data & Analytics SEB Kort, via mail johan.morling@seb.se eller Talent Acquisition Partner Karl Saeter via mail karl.saeter@seb.se

Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på SEB här: www.sebgroup.com/career

Vi är övertygade om att inkludering och mångfald är avgörande för vår framtida framgång. Vi strävar efter en inkluderande och värderingsdriven kultur där medarbetare känner sig uppskattade, respekterade och engagerade oavsett vilka de är, vad de tror på eller var de kommer ifrån.
Show more

Om du har frågor om rollen, vänligen kontakta Johan Morling, Head of Data & Analytics SEB Kort, via mail johan.morling@seb.se eller Talent Acquisition Partner Karl Saeter via mail karl.saeter@seb.se

Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på SEB här: www.sebgroup.com/career

Vi är övertygade om att inkludering och mångfald är avgörande för vår framtida framgång. Vi strävar efter en inkluderande och värderingsdriven kultur där medarbetare känner sig uppskattade, respekterade och engagerade oavsett vilka de är, vad de tror på eller var de kommer ifrån.

Title: Python developer
Description:
Role:

As a Python developer in the team, you will be part of a group that develops and maintains systems to conduct market surveillance and detect any form of financial market manipulation, as well as prevent rogue trading activities. Your role as a Python developer will be to ensure the quality and efficiency of deliveries, both by developing new solutions and maintaining existing ones

Essential requirements:


Experienced and devoted Python developer
A professional with a DevSecOps mindset and versatility in technical approaches
Experience with GitHub Actions or equivalent CI/CD tools
Familiarity with OpenShift
An analytical thinker capable of untangling complex technical challenges
You are open to change and thrive on new technologies and continuous improvement
A proactive team player who values collaboration and collective success


Meritorious:


Knowledge in Java
Familiarity with Docker or Google Cloud will be an advantage
Experience from banking in general and financial markets and trading in particular


Please explain how you meet all the requirements when applying.

Utilization: 100%

Location: Stockholm

Period: 22-09-2024-31-08-2025

Last day to apply: 05-09-2024

HTML:
Role:

As a Python developer in the team, you will be part of a group that develops and maintains systems to conduct market surveillance and detect any form of financial market manipulation, as well as prevent rogue trading activities. Your role as a Python developer will be to ensure the quality and efficiency of deliveries, both by developing new solutions and maintaining existing ones

Essential requirements:

  • Experienced and devoted Python developer
  • A professional with a DevSecOps mindset and versatility in technical approaches
  • Experience with GitHub Actions or equivalent CI/CD tools
  • Familiarity with OpenShift
  • An analytical thinker capable of untangling complex technical challenges
  • You are open to change and thrive on new technologies and continuous improvement
  • A proactive team player who values collaboration and collective success

Meritorious:

  • Knowledge in Java
  • Familiarity with Docker or Google Cloud will be an advantage
  • Experience from banking in general and financial markets and trading in particular

Please explain how you meet all the requirements when applying.

Utilization: 100%

Location: Stockholm

Period: 22-09-2024-31-08-2025

Last day to apply: 05-09-2024

Title: Senior ML Engineer
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?




Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.




Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.
Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorised as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.




We, at the Data Science and Analytics Products team, build centralised data products that serve the business and our customers. We collaborate across all of Truecaller, delivering products that require centralised ownership or where the competence to build the products is not present in the wider product organisation.




As a Senior ML Engineer, you will be working hands-on to optimise training and deployment of ML models to be quick and cost-efficient. You will also be at the forefront of putting our ML models on mobile devices to enhance data privacy and customer experience. To achieve this you will need to collaborate with teams across Truecaller to establish best practices and tools for efficient ML model development and deployment, particularly on mobile platforms. You will be expected to help Truecaller reach and stay at the cutting edge of ML training and deployment, as well as explore new frontiers such as federated learning.




The impact you will create:




Understand the current and future needs of developers and the organisation, and create a roadmap with your manager for meeting those needs.
Work with teams throughout Truecaller, enabling them to put models into production quickly and cost-effectively.
Work hands-on with teams throughout Truecaller to optimise ML models for mobile devices.
Be the go-to expert for developing models for mobile devices as well as deploying them.
Staying up to date with the latest trends and technologies in ML Engineering, especially ML on mobile phones, and driving continuous innovation throughout Truecaller.




What you bring in:




5+ years of experience in machine learning engineering, with a focus on deploying ML models in production environments.
Hands-on experience deploying ML models on mobile devices (e.g., TensorFlow Lite, Core ML, ONNX Runtime Mobile).
Strong understanding of machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, ONNX) and their deployment on mobile platforms.
Understanding of both Android and iOS development and how that impacts ML model deployment and usage.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across different teams and disciplines.
A customer-focused mindset.
Excellent communication skills in spoken and written English.




It would be great if you also have:




Hands-on experience developing ML models.







Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/




Sounds like your dream job?




We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.

This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

We only accept applications in English.




What we offer:




A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
Do it your way: We work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays with flexibility on the other days.
Office life: Enjoy your days with a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages, and have fun in our playroom! As well as in our exciting company parties and team activities such as Lab days, Running team, and Geek lunch!




Come as you are:




Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a dynamic and innovative Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our team. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a startup environment and is passionate about developing cutting-edge AI solutions. As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to drive our AI initiatives forward.

Company Description

Hypertype is an AI-powered text based communication platform that finds the most relevant information and writes smarter customer emails & live chats, using real-time company data.

305 billion emails sent and received every single day. We live in an information overload era, with ever-changing customer scenarios to process and answer. Customer facing roles still spend 20-30 mins just to find the right answers and draft high quality email, connecting the dots from millions of data sitting inside their company. Our vision is to make the smartest experience for customer communications with data.

Only a single digit % of SMEs has adopted AI in their customer facing teams. We have over 200 paying companies including Mynt, Yazen, Remote and many more. Our customers are proud to say that 'Hypertype generates the most accurate responses in the market'.

Our goal is to build the world's smartest and most accurate brain for CS and many more domains. We’re honored to be recognized by our customers as delivering the "highest quality answers in the market... smarter than Gemini, Fin, Microsoft Copilot etc"—a testament to our unwavering commitment to excellence and precision in every interaction.

The Position

The Senior ML Engineer is responsible for developing Hyperbrain AI to become world's smartest and accurate brain for CS and many more domains. Hyperbrain ingests and stores high quality data which is unique for each company. Company data is ingested from omni- data sources into Hyperbrain in one-click. Hyperbrain then automatically writes customer communications with the most relevant data in the reply interfaces e.g. Intercom, Gmail and Outlook, to answer trillions of customer scenarios that is beyond standard Chatbot conversations.

In the role, you will design, develop, and deploy machine learning models that directly impact Hypertype products. You will work closely with customer data, ensuring the models are not only accurate and efficient but also compliant with data privacy regulations.


Developing new product experiences using NLP & LLMs and working closely with customers to understand their needs and ensure successful implementation.
Implementing and shipping state-of-the-art information retrieval systems and search algorithms.
Prompt engineering and fine-tuning to improve the quality of customer communications for different scenarios.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to align technical decisions with business goals and co-develop ML roadmap.
Collaborating with the co-founders and Sales team to provide technical expertise during the sales process, including the creation of technical proposals, product demonstrations and solution design.
Ability to think outside the box and work towards multi-modality e.g. images, audios
Own problems end-to-end, and are willing to pick up whatever knowledge you’re missing to get the job done.


Qualification


A Solid Educational Foundation: Bachelor’s degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science or related field; Master’s degree is a plus.
At least 3 years of experience in building machine learning pipelines and / or information retrieval systems and are up to speed on latest in NLP & LLMs.
Versatile Software Engineering Skills: A solid engineering background with a robust foundation in software engineering principles. You have written code for and supported production engineering systems.
Proficient in Python and experience with GCP: our AI stack uses Python, Hugging Face, PyTorch & Elasticsearch and is deployed on GKE.
Passionate in solving RAG challenges


Bonus points


Experience with ETL processes, data pipelines and large-scale data processing.
Familiar with tools like Airbyte, Apache Airflow, or similar.
Experience with Node and Typescript.


The Offer


Opportunity to be part in a generative AI startup before the next AI inflection point.
A role and position that enables you to be part of building and shaping the way how customer information is shared and communicated.
Take part of our journey as we grow to be at the forefront to solve AI challenges and work towards building Hyperbrain AI for every domain for a decision-making AI.
Competitive salary + Stock option + Opportunity to grow in the role


At Hypertype, we look for positive, 'always learning' and humble personalities. We welcome everyone to apply if you feel it suits you and let’s have a chat to see if you could be right for the role.

  • Opportunity to be part in a generative AI startup before the next AI inflection point.
  • A role and position that enables you to be part of building and shaping the way how customer information is shared and communicated.
  • Take part of our journey as we grow to be at the forefront to solve AI challenges and work towards building Hyperbrain AI for every domain for a decision-making AI.
  • Competitive salary + Stock option + Opportunity to grow in the role

At Hypertype, we look for positive, 'always learning' and humble personalities. We welcome everyone to apply if you feel it suits you and let’s have a chat to see if you could be right for the role.

Title: Staff Data Scientist - Generalist
Description:
We are looking for a motivated Staff Data Scientist as Generalist capable of designing and developing value-add data-driven applications. You will be responsible for creating highly scalable and performant applications to deliver functionality to our engineers, enabling them to achieve the best quality in our manufacturing processes.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to contribute to a sustainable future by shaping the way we produce energy. You will work with cutting-edge technology in a dynamic, global environment. As part of a diverse and collaborative team, you will help achieve ambitious goals and be at the forefront of transforming the battery industry through data and AI innovation.

Key Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To


Data Analysis and Problem Solving: Handle extensive, intricate data sets to address challenging and non-standard analytical issues using advanced techniques. Perform thorough analysis, including data collection, requirements specification, processing, analysis, continuous reporting, and presentations.
Collaboration: Work closely with stakeholders to refine problem definitions, scope analyses, and leverage findings to guide data-driven decision-making.
Manufacturing Quality Improvement: Identify opportunities for improvement, design effective solutions, and develop software tools to enhance the quality of manufacturing processes.
Prototype Development: Create and iteratively refine analysis pipelines to deliver large-scale insights.
Application Support: Manage and support the operation of production applications within manufacturing environments.


The person we are looking for is someone with strong problem-solving skills and analytical thinking. Excellent communication skills are essential, as you'll need to present technology in a clear and concise manner. The ability to work effectively in a team and collaborate with diverse groups of people is crucial. We also value self-motivation and the ability to work independently.

Northvolt is an equal opportunity employer. We're a diverse group of individuals, united by a common mission, who recognise that while our actions as individuals have a role to play in driving Northvolt towards its goals, we always seek to move forward as a team. We offer you an open and welcoming atmosphere where we win as a team – and fail as a team. Northvolt is growing at the speed of light and we are a strong believer in internal career development. For us it’s important to look at your skills and potential, please refrain form including your picture and age with your application to help us with this.

,

We Believe That You Have


Technical Proficiency: Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.
5+ years of experience in a data scientist role, preferably in the manufacturing or R&D sector.
Statistical and Machine Learning Expertise: Solid foundation in statistics and machine learning.
Model Building Experience: Proven experience in building machine learning models that deliver company value.
Software Development Skills: Experience writing clean and tested code in a professional environment.
DevOps and CICD Experience: Familiarity with Kubernetes, Docker, Jenkins, and related technologies.
Familiarity with AWS and Azure, especially data storage, processing, and compute technologies.
Hands-on experience with data transformation and WMS tools (e.g., Spark, Airflow).
Understanding of deploying and hosting web applications via Flask, FastAPI, or other frameworks.
Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills with an emphasis on clear documentation.
Attributes: Smart but humble, with a bias for action.


Bonus Points For


Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent.
Experience in Computer Vision and/or in Natural Language Processing Projects
Fullstack Knowledge: Comprehensive understanding of fullstack development.
Knowledge of front-end development in React and Python frameworks like Streamlit, Plotly/Dash.
Sysadmin Capabilities: Basic system administration skills.
Big Data Experience: Experience with Hadoop and Spark.
Stream Processing: Experience with streaming and stream processing frameworks such as Kafka, MQTT, Faust, Spark Streaming, etc.


Apply with CV in English.

Full time employment, fixed salary.

Planned starting date is ASAP.

Please note that candidates considered for employment with NV may be subject to a mandatory background check process.

Please note that any applications submitted via email or direct messaging will not be considered.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Python Developer | AI Technology | Automated Broadcasting Technology | Stockholm




About the Company: Join one of the most innovative companies in the AI space, where technology meets creativity. Our client, a dynamic SaaS Microsoft Partner, has developed a cutting-edge product that leverages AI to transform any live meeting into a professional, fully automated broadcast. With just a touch of a button, users can access a wide array of broadcasting features, making this an exciting opportunity to be part of a pioneering team in a rapidly growing field.




Position Overview: We are seeking a talented Python Developer to join our client's team in Stockholm. In this role, you will play a crucial part in designing, developing, and maintaining backend systems and services for their AI broadcasting platform. You will work in a collaborative environment with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality software solutions and continuously improve development processes and tools.




Key Responsibilities:

Design & Development: Create and maintain backend systems and services using Python.
API Management: Implement and manage APIs with Flask to ensure seamless real-time integration with other systems.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver robust and scalable software solutions.
Continuous Improvement: Contribute to the enhancement of development processes, tools, and methodologies.




Why You'll Love This Role:

Autonomy & Flexibility: Enjoy the freedom to manage your schedule and work in a way that suits you best. As long as tasks are completed, you have full autonomy over your day-to-day.
Innovative Environment: Collaborate with highly skilled software developers in self-managed, agile Scrum teams.
Career Growth: Take advantage of career development opportunities in a company that's growing and evolving.




Benefits:

Work-Life Balance: 90% remote work with between 1 and 2 days in the office per week.
Tech Perks: Receive a laptop of your choice, along with internet and mobile phone expenses covered.
Social & Learning: Participate in monthly social events, and enjoy lunch and learning budgets to foster both personal and professional growth.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of a fun and collaborative working environment where your contributions are valued.




If you're passionate about Python development and eager to work on an exciting AI product, we'd love to hear from you!




Contact Luqman Mohammed-Brown if you have any questions - L.mohammed-brown@tenthrevolution.com

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Marketing & Commercial Analytics
Description:
At Epidemic Sound, we make soundtracking content simple and inspiring with unlimited access to music and sound effects. Headquartered in Stockholm, with offices all over the world, we are a force of over 500 on a mission to soundtrack the world. Our innovative licensing model paves the way for creators - from YouTubers to small businesses to the world’s most recognizable brands such as Netflix, Redbull and BBC - to use sound to enhance their content while simultaneously supporting artists both financially and creatively. Epidemic Sound music is heard 2 billion times a day on YouTube alone and is recognized as one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies by the Financial Times. Epidemic Sound is backed by EQT, Blackstone, Creandum, Atwater Capital to name a few.

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist for our Commercial Analytics team.

Job Summary:

You'll be part of a team unlocking key insights to drive growth in a cutting-edge music tech company. From product development to exploring new business opportunities, refining and driving strategies in packaging, marketing and growth efforts, you'll be at the forefront of ensuring alignment and effective execution.

The position entails guiding senior stakeholders, as well as effectively managing cross-functional projects involving talented data scientists, data engineers, business leaders, and marketers. Expect to be part of a close-knit team, using advanced, industry-standard tools and expansive datasets, balancing your time between in-depth analysis, data modeling, and engagement in larger, collaborative projects.

To excel in this role, you thrive on understanding the ins-and-outs of the business and taking ownership of fascinating and complex problems, as well as mentoring your teammates.

Responsibilities:


Provide proactive guidance to senior stakeholders, including Product Managers, Marketing Managers, Senior Vice Presidents, and Chief Commercial Officer, aiding their decision-making
Utilize your expertise in areas such as marketing and subscriptions to uncover insights and recommendations aimed at enhancing business growth
Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams skilled in data science, design, research, engineering, and marketing, driving complex projects that deliver tangible value
Develop, document and share best practices spanning various aspects of analytics, including code, visualization techniques, and version control, to ensure consistency and efficiency



Requirements:


Proven ability to deconstruct projects into manageable components and lead them to successful completion, showcasing strong project management skills
Marketing Analytics Expertise: Deep understanding of multi touch attribution (MTA), marketing mix models (MMM), experimentation design, measurements frameworks and the nuances of diminishing returns and incrementality
Demonstrated proficiency in data analysis and visualization, with a focus on deriving and delivering actionable insights to inform business strategies
Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities to effectively convey findings and recommendations to diverse audiences
A minimum of 7 years of prior experience as a data scientist working with marketing and knowledge subscriptions
Proficiency in Python/R for data analysis and SQL for data querying and manipulation



Preferred Qualifications/ Bonus Skills:


Proficiency in tools such as Git, dbt, Looker and BigQuery
Sound understanding and hands-on experience with data engineering practices



Equal Opportunity Employer:

We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.

Application

Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.

Epidemic Sound, the market leading platform for restriction-free music, is headquartered in Stockholm, heard around the globe and on a mission to soundtrack the world.The company has democratized access to music for storytellers. Its innovative digital rights model paves the way for creators - everyone from YouTubers to small businesses to the world’s largest brands - to use restriction-free music to take their content to the next level, whilst simultaneously supporting the musicians it works with both financially and creatively.The company was co-founded in 2009, operates across the globe, and has offices in five major cities: Stockholm, New York, Los Angeles, Seoul and Amsterdam. Epidemic Sound is backed by EQT, Blackstone, Creandum, Atwater Capital, Alecta. AMF, and TIN Fonder and its Chairperson is Andrew Fisher, former CEO and Chairman of Shazam.
Show more

At Epidemic Sound, we make soundtracking content simple and inspiring with unlimited access to music and sound effects. Headquartered in Stockholm, with offices all over the world, we are a force of over 500 on a mission to soundtrack the world. Our innovative licensing model paves the way for creators - from YouTubers to small businesses to the world’s most recognizable brands such as Netflix, Redbull and BBC - to use sound to enhance their content while simultaneously supporting artists both financially and creatively. Epidemic Sound music is heard 2 billion times a day on YouTube alone and is recognized as one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies by the Financial Times. Epidemic Sound is backed by EQT, Blackstone, Creandum, Atwater Capital to name a few.

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist for our Commercial Analytics team.

Job Summary:

You'll be part of a team unlocking key insights to drive growth in a cutting-edge music tech company. From product development to exploring new business opportunities, refining and driving strategies in packaging, marketing and growth efforts, you'll be at the forefront of ensuring alignment and effective execution.

The position entails guiding senior stakeholders, as well as effectively managing cross-functional projects involving talented data scientists, data engineers, business leaders, and marketers. Expect to be part of a close-knit team, using advanced, industry-standard tools and expansive datasets, balancing your time between in-depth analysis, data modeling, and engagement in larger, collaborative projects.

  • Develop, document and share best practices spanning various aspects of analytics, including code, visualization techniques, and version control, to ensure consistency and efficiency

  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities to effectively convey findings and recommendations to diverse audiences

  • Proficiency in tools such as Git, dbt, Looker and BigQuery
  • Sound understanding and hands-on experience with data engineering practices

Title: Python Developer
Description:
I'm working with a well-established & innovative company in Stockholm who are harnessing the power of AI to enable a revolutionized video meeting & broadcasting experience!




With a close partnership with Microsoft directly, their product is a fully automated solution that enables anyone to create compelling video streaming & audio content, optimizing & enhancing the capability of Microsoft Teams, LinkedIn live, YouTube broadcasting and beyond, through the use of AI to create professional-grade content, easier than ever before!




Based in Stockholm and across Sweden, they have a talented and established team of engineers, they are looking to expand and bring in another passionate engineer who is keen to build a cutting-edge product!




They have an office in Stockholm and typically have 2 days per week in office, but can be super flexible and for them, the most important thing is that someone is enthusiastic and excited to be part of the journey!




Currently, they are looking for an experienced Python backend engineer to work on the brains of their system, which produces the output stream based on incoming audio/video feeds and configuration!




Key Responsibilities




Design, develop, and maintain backend systems and services for the platform.
Implement and manage APIs to ensure seamless integration with other systems in real time.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality software solutions.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes and tools.




Required Qualifications

Experience: 3+ years of professional experience in Python development.




Technical Skills:
Proficiency in Python with a deep understanding of its libraries and frameworks.
Experience with Flask or similar API libraries for developing and managing APIs.
Strong understanding of backend development principles and best practices.
Experience with Docker for containerization and deployment.







Additional Skills:
Knowledge of software development lifecycle and agile methodologies.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Proficiency in Bash scripting for automation and system tasks.










Preferred Qualifications but not essential!




Experience with real-time data processing.
Familiarity with computer vision libraries and concepts (though not required).
Prior experience in video processing or production tools.
Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.

Title: Data Scientist, Solna
Description:
We seek to strengthen our position and increase the speed of the implementation of data science, machine learning and AI solutions in PostNord. We are looking for three Data Scientists who will play an important role in helping PostNord to become an AI and data driven business. We offer you a cutting-edge Analytics environment, very competent colleagues as well as good benefits and a really cool office. Apply now to the Data Scientist role!

Join us

The Technology Acceleration area with Group IT is responsible for establishing the future IT landscape that will be the foundation for PostNord' s continued AI and data driven journey. PostNord is the leader of logistics and postal services in the Nordics. As a Data Scientist at PostNord you will engage in projects, combining technical expertise within areas such data collection and exploration, model development and model deployment and operation. As a Data Scientist, you will are able to independently develop and deploy models, both statistical and machine learning. We are looking for data scientists for our existing ML team which delivers production volume forecast to PostNords business and we are also looking for data scientists to our newly formed AI- and Concept development teams. It is our goal to deploy efficient and accurate models and keep the models up to date through a set of well-defined MLOps practices.

Job Duties


Work in an agile team to deliver the best possible data solutions for PostNord.
Identify, prepare, explore and analyze data from various data sets.
Understand the business requirements and develop ML solutions accordingly.
Ensure best practices, such as quality and security, are followed in all stages of the product development life cycle.
Identify, collect and analyze data and train new ML models.
Collaborate within team boundaries aiming to share knowledge and best practices.
Keeps up to date with data science trends in and outside of PostNord.
Sound knowledge of statistics and machine learning.
take ownership of the teams solutions whether new or old and help establish best in class MLOps .


We are looking for you who have


A bachelor's degree or higher in computer science, mathematics, statistics, or a related field.
At least 3-5 years of work experience
Proficiency in Python and at least one of the following frameworks: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, or Scikit-learn.
Sound knowledge of statistics
Strong knowledge of machine learning concepts and techniques, such as supervised and unsupervised learning, classification, regression, clustering, feature engineering, and model evaluation.
Experience in applying machine learning methods to real-world data sets and problems, preferably in the domain of production forecasting or time series analysis.
Understanding of core AI and ML concepts, algorithms, and their applications
Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, and to translate business requirements into data-driven solutions.
Experience in working with time series data and using frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or Keras for building and training neural network models for forecasting or anomaly detection.


Your profile as an Data Scientist

You have worked with statistical analysis and Machine Learning solutions in an agile team before. You like to work hands on, and to work directly with our business stakeholders. You have an academic background and as a person you are curious to learn and evolve your skill set in accordance with the state-of-the-art pace in the domain that you work in.

Meritorious experience: (Nice-to-have)


Experience in developing and deploying end-to-end machine learning pipelines in cloud-based environments (Azure preferred) using tools such as MLflow, Azure ML Studio and Azure DevOps.
Experience in working with cloud platforms (Azure preferred) and using their services for data storage, processing, and analysis.
Data visualisation experience; preferably in Power BI
Prior experience implementing generative AI/LLM’s or ML.
Experience in applying DevOps principles and practices to machine learning projects, such as version control, testing, continuous integration, and continuous delivery.
Experience in using containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, or Helm for building and deploying scalable and reproducible machine learning applications.


System requirements:


Azure ML Studio, Azure DevOps, Azure Open AI (or similar AWS/GCP technologies)
Python, Pandas
SQL
Power BI


Language requirement:

Fluent English in speech and writing. Proficiency in at least one Scandinavian language is meritorious.

We offer you

Benefits

We offer you a flexible hybrid workplace with a prestige-free environment where we as a team help each other to reach our goals. We encourage self-sufficient leadership for development and career opportunities. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:


Work in a Nordic/International and flexible environment.
Good insurance and occupational pension conditions
Wellness allowance & access to office gym and swimming pool
Employee benefits through PostNord's own employee foundation PostNord Plus
Employment according to a collective agreement.


We make everyday life easier

PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.

We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead our self or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com

Apply

We look forward to receiving your application! If you have any questions or concerns, you are welcome to contact Christian Mejlvang, Christian.mejlvang@postnord.com

Click here for union contacts
