Title: (Junior) Data Scientist – Insights Consultancy
Description:
(Junior) Data Scientist – Insights Consultancy

£35 – 45,000; London (Hybrid working)

A technically adept (junior) Data Scientist is sought by the highly visible Data Science team of this leading global insights consultancy in a key role.




The Data Science Team here covers numerous segmentation and conjoint led insights projects, grounded in survey data, and working closely with consulting teams and clients in so doing – but they are also involved in wider corporate initiatives where data science input is required too.




In joining this team you’ll bring technical and coding prowess to compliment a team made up of skilled Data Scientists from market research backgrounds. You’ll therefore be a (junior) Data Scientist who ideally has good skills in Python (and R), machine learning, Bayesian methods, text analytics, econometrics and more. You don’t necessarily have to have previously worked in market research, but an interest in pivoting towards this form of data and helping to develop the team’s overall innovative approach to insights led data science approaches will be highly advantageous.




If you’re a UK based programmer/coder with data science aspirations, an interest in insights/market research, and are keen to find a fulfilling technical role in a company that will value and develop you further (relocation and sponsorship [including post any visa expiry] is not available at this time), contact Carl at Resources Group




About Resources Group:




With over twenty five years’ experience helping thousands of Researchers, Insight Specialists, Marketers and Data Analysts in their career moves, no one has better knowledge of the Market Research, Insights and Marketing Strategy job market than Resources Group. Our consultants take the time to understand your career aims and are dedicated to providing impartial advice and finding you the best career move, with access to an unrivalled range of opportunities with top employers in the sector - visit our website for many more options!




Resources Group’s Diversity and Equality Policy determines that we submit applicants to our clients on the basis of merit and ability, regardless of race, colour, age, disability, family responsibilities, gender, marital status, nationality, religious or political views or affiliations, sexual orientation or socio-economic background.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Mid-Level/Senior Data Scientist

London - Hybrid

£60k - £100k DOE




We're partnered with a scale-up AI firm who are on a mission to advance human decision-making. They've grown massively in the past few years, raising over $40 million in Series A funding and winning multiple awards.




Responsibilities:

Utilise a causal AI framework to create models and decision-making applications based on proprietary techniques for causal discovery, modelling, and decision intelligence.
Occasionally partner with clients and stakeholders to develop strategies.




Required Experience:

2+ years of experience in a high performing environment.
Strong academic STEM background.
Machine learning and advanced analytics.
Excellent communication skills.




NOTE: We are unable to offer sponsorship and candidates must be based in the UK.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist | Leading Private Jet Broker | Hybrid | London




Our client, a leading Private Jet Broker ranked among the UK’s Top 100 firms and recognized as a Band 1 Aviation partner, is seeking a talented Data Scientist to join their team in London. This is a hybrid role that offers the flexibility of remote work combined with an engaging office environment.




About the Role:

You’ll have the opportunity to enhance their data capabilities, leveraging your Python expertise to build predictive models and support key business functions. In this role, you’ll focus on segmenting data and building models to assist their sales, marketing, and automation teams. Your work will involve analysing historical data, generating insights, and predicting trends.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement predictive models using Python
Leverage Zoho CRM to segment and manage data
Utilise historical data for trend analysis and model prediction
Collaborate with sales and marketing teams to drive data-driven decision-making
Assist in automating workflows and optimising business operations

What’s in it for you?

25 days of annual leave, plus UK bank holidays
Private medical cover
Summer Fridays with early finishes at 1 pm
Cycle to Work scheme
Season ticket loan
Dog-friendly office!
Flexible hybrid working pattern to suit your lifestyle




If you're looking for an exciting opportunity to work with a high-profile company in the aviation industry, let’s chat! Feel free to send over your contact details, and we can discuss this opportunity in more detail.




Looking forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Builder.ai

We're on a mission to make app building so easy everyone can do it - regardless of their background, tech knowledge or budget. We've already helped thousands of entrepreneurs, small businesses and global brands, like NBC Universal and Pepsi, as well as American organizations like Bobcat and Smart Path, achieve their software goals. And we've only just started!

Builder.ai was voted as one of 2023's ‘Most Innovative Companies in AI' by Fast Company, and won Europas 2022 ‘Scaleup of the Year'. Our team has grown to over 800 people across the world and our recent announcement of $250m Series D funding (and partnership with Microsoft) means there's never been a more exciting time to become a Builder.

Life at Builder.ai

At Builder.ai we encourage you to experiment! Each role at Builder has unlimited opportunities to learn, progress and challenge the status quo. We want you to help us become even better at supporting our customers and take AI app building to new heights.

Our global team is diverse, collaborative and exceptionally talented. We hire people for their differences but all unite with our shared belief in Builder's HEARTT values: (Heart, Entrepreneurship, Accountability, Respect, Trust and Transparency) and a let's-get-stuff-done attitude.

In return for your skills and commitment, we offer range of great perks, from hybrid working and a variable annual bonus, to employee stock options, generous paid leave, and trips abroad #WhatWillYouBuild

Why we need this role

Our data scientists will be a part of the Intelligent Systems based in London but will work closely and collaborate with global product and engineering teams across the globe. The Intelligent Systems team is at the forefront of driving innovation through cutting-edge data science, machine learning, and generative AI technologies. As a crucial part of our organization, this team is poised for substantial growth in the coming year and beyond.

Our team is responsible for spearheading a wide range of existing use cases, driving Builder's Code Generation effort, taking ownership of our proprietary knowledge graph and leveraging advanced data analysis to derive valuable insights and make data-driven decisions.

Key problems include:


Utilizing generative AI for code generation and automating software assembly
Harnessing our proprietary knowledge graph to optimize the customer journey
Advancing internal text-to-image generation capabilities tailored to customer-specific content
Employing historical data to forecast software project price and timeline
Optimizing developer workforce allocation to align with customer demand and business metrics
Analyzing dependency structures and identifying bottlenecks in the software development life cycle
Automating quality assurance processes and cloud resource allocation in software development



Requirements


PhD or advanced Masters in Statistics, Computer Science, Machine Learning & AI, Mathematics, or Physics
Hands-on experience in at least three of the following areas: Generative AI, Supervised and Unsupervised Learning, Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Recommendation Systems, Knowledge Graphs, Probabilistic Inference, Bayesian Statistics, Reinforcement Learning
Strong industry experience, with a focus on taking concepts and models from conception to production and quantifying business impact
Proficiency in Python programming
Expertise in GIT and the data science Python stack
Experience with real-world data querying, manipulation, and feature engineering
Familiarity with cloud technologies
Strong attention to detail and ability to work independently with given direction
Efficient time and task management skills
Entrepreneurial mindset and a can-do attitude
Passion for software development and engineering
Ability to collaborate in interdisciplinary teams of product, engineering, business, and technology experts



Desired Skills


Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively engage with diverse stakeholders
Experience in a consumer-oriented, product-focused, or eCommerce business
Strong academic research background with a proven track record of accomplishments
Knowledge of graph databases and proficiency in Cypher query language
Familiarity with vector databases and expertise in Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG)
Hands-on experience in self-hosting and fine-tuning of open source Generative AI models
Ability to propose innovative and tailored solutions to non-standard machine learning problems
Track record of industry recognition which could be in the form of high impact ML/AI conference contributions, contribution to high impact open source projects or performance in open source competitions such as Kaggle



Benefits


Attractive quarterly OKR bonus plan or commission scheme dependant on your role
Stock options in a $450 million funded Series D scale-up company
24 days annual leave + bank holidays
2 x Builder family days each year
Time off between Christmas and New Year
Generous Referral Bonus scheme
Pension contributions
Private Medical Insurance provided by AXA
Private Dental Insurance provided by Bupa
Access to our Perkbox
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist




An AI start-up who are at the forefront of voice modelling and voice products have just received an enormous influx of funding and are looking to build out their core Data Science team. They have partnered already with some of the most renowned publishers in the world and have over 1 million users to date.




They're looking for Applied Data Scientists who enjoy dealing directly with end-users and are able to implement solutions in real-time leveraging Time Series and Tabular analysis.




The tech stack is Python focussed using a combination of Python/Cython/Numpy/Torch and everything is in AWS and GCP.




Required:

1+ years Data Science experience in an enterprise environment or a PhD.
Strong Mathematics, Physics (or a related subject) background at MSc level or higher.
Able to work in a modern engineering environment, using Agile and DevOps methodologies.




Benefits:

Market leading compensation packages.
Strong appreciation for work-life balance with a massive emphasis on culture-driven values.
Ability to work remotely up to 3 days a week.
The opportunity to work for an incredibly exciting firm in a very collaborative culture.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist, Machine Learning, Consultant, Audit, Analytics, Python, R, Azure, SQL, Power BI, Cloud – Consulting, Permanent, UK Wide – Up to £55,000 Base + Cash Allowance + Bonus + Benefits




My client, a leading UK Consultancy are seeking a Junior Data Science / Machine Learning professional to join their Audit and Assurance consulting arm in one of their UK regional offices on a permanent basis.




You will be joining a rapidly expanding and challenging business, responsible for delivery across a range of audit and assurance analytics offerings, providing data science and analytics services to deliver insights to clients with the use of Python, DataBricks, R, SQL and Power BI. You will also be involved in the revision of internal and third party data science and cloud solutions, developing and delivering new and innovative Data Science and Machine Learning tools and solutions in order to evolve the audit and assurance business line.




The ideal candidate will have exposure to some of the following:

Proven Python experience
Excellent understanding of mathematical principles behind machine learning tools
Proven experience using and deploying machine learning algorithms
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
End to end data science project experience (data wrangling, feature engineering, model validation etc)
Experience with cloud environments
Experience using Azure Databricks, Azure MLflow, Azure ML services and/or other ML services.




This is an excellent opportunity to join a rapidly growing team in a leading consultancy, utilising cutting edge technology.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Product Analytics
Description:
Bumble is looking for a senior data scientist to join our team and play a key role in fulfilling our mission of being the # 1 choice for people to find love, friendship and community around the world.

At Bumble, analytics functions as a core driver of business impact alongside engineering, product, and operations. We are constantly looking for opportunities, providing actionable insights, and navigating trade-offs.

The ideal candidate has extensive experience in experimentation and causal inference. They combine strong business acumen with a passion for building products customers love and a continuous desire to develop their craft.




WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING
Proactively identify opportunities and contribute insights that influence decision-making. 
Design metrics to provide structure and clarity for product and business teams. Helping to evaluate trade-offs and measure the success of product efforts
Act as a subject matter expert in experimentation and causal inference
Influence leadership to drive more data-informed decisions. This requires bringing a holistic view of the health of our ecosystem. 
Continuously push and adopt best practices across the advanced data analytics team





WE’D LOVE TO MEET SOMEONE WITH
Deep expertise in experimentation, A|B testing and causal inference
Experience with a wide range of analytical approaches, methodologies and frameworks
Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Experience using data to push forward product development
An ability to work collaboratively and proactively in a fast-paced environment alongside scientists, engineers and non-technical stakeholders
A dedication and commitment to developing your craft
A deep understanding of advanced SQL techniques, Python and data modelling





AN ADDED BONUS IF YOU HAVE
An understanding of multi-sided markets and/or the dating problem space





Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Harmonic Security, a cutting-edge startup with joint headquarters in the UK and US, is leading the charge in data protection for the future. We're on a mission to empower organizations to leverage the power of generative AI, without compromising security or privacy.

As our Data Scientist, you'll be a critical member of our team, laying the groundwork for groundbreaking advancements in secure Generative AI adoption. Your expertise will be instrumental in building high-quality datasets that fuel our innovative models.

Here's where you'll make a significant impact:


Working collaboratively to design and curate comprehensive datasets tailored to train and fine-tune our sensitive data detection models
Your keen eye and meticulous approach will ensure data accuracy and completeness, a vital foundation for robust and reliable models
You'll stay abreast of the latest data science trends and techniques, continuously seeking ways to optimize dataset creation to enhance model performance
You'll collaborate effectively with engineers and security teams, fostering clear communication around data needs and ensuring seamless integration with our security solutions


You'll be directly contributing to the development of groundbreaking technology that empowers secure Generative AI adoption within enterprises.

Requirements

This role is a great fit for someone with:


Models running in production and integrated into a live product
A proven track record of building and managing high-quality datasets
A desire to work in a fast-paced, innovative environment
A product driven mindset with a focus on incremental delivery
Expert knowledge of Python and relevant libraries
Knowledge of natural language processing (NLP) techniques
Excellent communication and collaboration skills


Bonus points if you have:


Experience building systems that utilise generative AI models
Experience working in the data security domain
Strong understanding of classification approaches and models
Strong understanding of data categorization techniques and taxonomies
Been in front of customers and/or end-users to build a complete understanding of the problem domain
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)


Benefits

Harmonic Security offers a competitive package:


Competitive Salary & Health: Market-rate salary with private healthcare & dental
Startup Culture: Be part of a dynamic team with innovation at its core
Continuous Learning: Develop your skills with training programs and industry resources
Work-Life Balance: Enjoy a flexible hybrid work environment (office is based in Kings Cross)
Shared Success: Everyone holds stock options, where we all share in the success of the company
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Are you an ambitious individual with a passion for machine learning and computer vision?




Imagine applying your expertise to projects that not only challenge you but also make a real difference across multiple industries. If you’re looking to be part of something big, this opportunity could be exactly what you’ve been searching for.




Our client, a global innovator in software and hardware solutions, is offering an exciting role as a Machine Learning Engineer. This isn’t just another job; it’s a chance to work on cutting-edge technology that’s transforming fields like entertainment, engineering, and healthcare.




Here’s why this role could be the perfect next step for your career:




What’s in It for You?

Innovative Work Environment: You’ll be at the forefront of AI and computer vision, contributing to projects that push the boundaries of technology. Your work will directly impact applications used in movies, games, VR, and medical research. This is your chance to be part of something truly groundbreaking.
Career Development: We believe in investing in our people. You’ll have an annual budget dedicated to your professional growth, so whether you want to attend conferences, take advanced courses, or get certified in new technologies, we’ve got you covered.
Hybrid Working Flexibility: Enjoy the best of both worlds with our hybrid working model. You’ll have the flexibility to work from home and collaborate in our Oxfordshire office, giving you a balanced work-life experience.
Competitive Compensation: Earn a salary up to £80k, depending on your experience. This role also includes a company performance bonus, ensuring you’re rewarded for your contributions.
Comprehensive Benefits Package: Your wellbeing is important to us. That’s why we offer 25 days of annual leave (plus bank holidays), comprehensive health and life insurance, and more. We want you to thrive, both professionally and personally.
Impactful Work: Be part of a team where your contributions aren’t just valued—they’re crucial. You’ll have the chance to work on high-impact projects that make a tangible difference in the world, from improving healthcare diagnostics to enhancing entertainment experiences.




Why This Role?

This role offers more than just a job title; it offers a platform to grow, innovate, and make a difference. If you’re eager to work in a challenging, supportive environment where your skills are valued and your potential is limitless, this is the opportunity for you.




Ready to take the next step in your career? Reach out or hit 'Apply' to discover more about this exciting Machine Learning Engineer position.




At Humand Talent Solutions, we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds and are dedicated to ensuring equal opportunities for everyone. If you notice any language in our communications that doesn’t align with these values, please let us know immediately.

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
As an ML Engineer, you'll work directly with the product team. In this fast-paced environment, you'll be given complex banking and data science problems to solve, develop and deploy. You are obsessed with our good architecture, efficiency, and resilience and want nothing but the best product for our customers.

Your speed, ability to deliver, and capacity to come up with the most elegant solutions will make you one of the pillars of our engineering team.

We want to revolutionize the FinTech industry. Create a new paradigm. And we need the best minds to do it 🧠 🚀

👀 What we are looking for


Experience with Python, Java/Kotlin and Spring Boot
Experience with Python machine learning frameworks
Understanding of relational and no-SQL databases like PostgreSQL and MongoDB
Ability to develop, test and deploy microservices with Kafka
Experience with GCP
Team players: Credit the team & Blame no-one


🤩 What will make you stand out:


4+ years of experience as a Backend and Data Science Engineer
Experience in data engineering and risk scoring models
Experience developing supervised and un-supervised Machine Learning algorithms


🧑‍💻 What you'll be working on:


Develop the core banking services
Develop in-house data science services



🤑 What You'll Get


Competitive salary + stock options
Private dental + health insurance
The best tech for your job
30 days of paid holidays (excl. bank holidays)
Option to work 100% remotely or come to the office - your choice!
Ability to work abroad for 4 months a year

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
BettingJobs are working with a sports analytics company who work with clients in the iGaming industry, who are seeking the hire of a Data Scientist to be based out of London.




About The Role:




They are looking for a data scientist to work on the betting and prediction side of their business, helping them to improve their ability to predict match outcomes. This role involves researching ways in which the modelling approaches they use to predict football matches can be improved, and then turning those insights into practical modelling solutions that they can deploy to production.




You will have flexibility to work from home one day a week, and they aren't too fussy about the exact hours you work each day. But please note they are not considering remote candidates at the moment.




Essential Requirements:

Strong problem solving skills, with an ability to proactively identify challenges and propose solutions
Interest in football and betting/prediction problems
An ability to make pragmatic and sensible choices about what data analysis and modelling approaches to use – you can judge when it’s right to obsess about the details, and when it’s right to ship an MVP as fast as possible.
A flair for communicating statistical analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Experience with statistical analysis and predictive modelling - you don’t need to be an expert in any one area, but you need to know what techniques and tools are available, and understand the trade-offs of using different approaches
Experience with SQL and relational databases – you can quickly understand a new dataset, perform exploratory analysis, identify data quality issues, and take pragmatic decisions about how to handle imperfect data
Some programming experience, preferably with Python.




For senior candidates:




More experienced candidates will have the opportunity to take on more responsibility, leading projects and helping set the direction of the research. They are looking for candidates who can think strategically and make pragmatic decisions about where they should focus their efforts, and what technical approaches they should use to get the modelling ideas onto production. In addition to the requirements above, this means you also have:




3+ years of practical data science experience
Project management skills, including an ability to make sensible value judgements about where the team should spend time
An extensive knowledge of statistical methods and machine learning techniques
Strong programming skills, ideally with Python
Experience working with other data scientists on a collaborative codebase
Experience of deploying models to production, ideally in AWS or another cloud environment

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title: Data Scientist - Computer Vision

Location: London, United Kingdom

Employment Type: Full-time

Salary: £80,000-£100,000




About the Role:

We are looking for a Data Scientist specialising in Computer Vision to join our team in London. As a founding member, you will leverage your expertise in data science and computer vision to develop and deploy innovative solutions that drive the success of our cutting-edge products.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and optimise computer vision algorithms for image and video analysis, including pose estimation, object detection, image segmentation, and pattern recognition.
Perform data pre-processing, feature extraction, and exploratory data analysis to build robust models that address complex visual problems.
Collaborate with engineering teams to deploy models into production, ensuring scalability, efficiency, and robustness.




Qualifications:

Educational Background: Master’s or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Data Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
Experience: 5+ years of experience in data science, with a proven track record in developing and deploying computer vision solutions.




If you are interested in applying, please apply here with your CV.

About the Role:

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and optimise computer vision algorithms for image and video analysis, including pose estimation, object detection, image segmentation, and pattern recognition.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Search
Description:
Teamwork makes the stream work.

Roku Is Changing How The World Watches TV

Roku is the #1 TV streaming platform in the US, and we've set our sights on powering every television in the world. Roku pioneered streaming to the TV. Our mission is to be the TV streaming platform that connects the entire TV ecosystem. We connect consumers to the content they love, enable content publishers to build and monetize large audiences, and provide advertisers unique capabilities to engage consumers.

From your first day at Roku, you'll make a valuable - and valued - contribution. We're a fast-growing public company where no one is a bystander. We offer you the opportunity to delight millions of TV streamers around the world while gaining meaningful experience across a variety of disciplines.

About The Team

The Core Analytics Team is a centralised function to provide data-driven insights to business and products. We collaborate closely with our Product and Engineering teams to deliver the best search experiences to our customers and maximise the value proposition for the business.

About The Role

Roku is looking for a Sr. Data Scientist to join the Core Analytics team supporting our Search product. This individual will be responsible for understanding how users leverage our search product to manage their Roku experience and work closely with product management and engineering to identify opportunities to create new features, drive their adoption, and generate value for Roku. This individual will investigate and develop solutions to track, monitor, and improve our search ecosystem. The successful candidate is quantitatively driven, detail-focused, and possesses an elevated level of problem-solving expertise.

What You'll Be Doing


Define and monitor KPIs that guide the growth of Roku’s Search product.
Analyse structured and unstructured data and communicate insights to help stakeholders solve business problems, identify trends and make data-driven decisions
Develop necessary data pipelines to power automation, validation and reporting
Collaborate with stakeholders to align data science initiatives with organisational goals and strategy design and execute AB tests
Develop analytical tools (real-time alerts, models, etc.) to understand what drives success for our search platform
Perform exploratory data analysis on emerging trends and execute advanced analysis across the entire search and Roku Platform
Collaborate with the Program Management and Engineering team to proactively seek and incorporate feedback
Providing feedback directly to search leadership on performance of various initiatives and untapped opportunities


We're excited if you have


5+ years of work experience with a bachelor's degree or master's degree in quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Business Analytics, Data Science, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering or Computer Science)
5+ years of experience across search, consumer product, digital media or entertainment industries
Expertise in SQL, SAS, R, Python or other programming language to query data and perform analysis
Hands on experience with visualization tools like Tableau or Looker
Have a bias towards action in resolving issues and operate in a high-energy, fast-paced environment
Hands on experience in A/B testing and statistical modeling/forecasting


Benefits

Roku is committed to offering a diverse range of benefits as part of our compensation package to support our employees and their families. Our comprehensive benefits include global access to mental health and financial wellness support and resources. Local benefits include statutory and voluntary benefits which may include healthcare (medical, dental, and vision), life, accident, disability, commuter, and retirement options (401(k)/pension). Our employees can take time off work for vacation and other personal reasons to balance their evolving work and life needs. It's important to note that not every benefit is available in all locations or for every role. For details specific to your location, please consult with your recruiter.

The Roku Culture

Roku is a great place for people who want to work in a fast-paced environment where everyone is focused on the company's success rather than their own. We try to surround ourselves with people who are great at their jobs, who are easy to work with, and who keep their egos in check. We appreciate a sense of humor. We believe a fewer number of very talented folks can do more for less cost than a larger number of less talented teams. We’re independent thinkers with big ideas who act boldly, move fast and accomplish extraordinary things through collaboration and trust. In short, at Roku you'll be part of a company that's changing how the world watches TV. 

We have a unique culture that we are proud of. We think of ourselves primarily as problem-solvers, which itself is a two-part idea. We come up with the solution, but the solution isn't real until it is built and delivered to the customer. That penchant for action gives us a pragmatic approach to innovation, one that has served us well since 2002. 

To learn more about Roku, our global footprint, and how we've grown, visit https://www.weareroku.com/factsheet.

By providing your information, you acknowledge that you have read our Applicant Privacy Notice and authorize Roku to process your data subject to those terms.


Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
LLM - Python for Machine Learning

Experience: 2 - 15 Years

Location- Permanent Remote Anywhere in the world

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, 5 hours Mandatory overlap with PST

Total Years Of exp- 2+ years Mandatory

Mandatory Skills- Python: min 2 years, Python for Data Science: min 1 yr, Machine Learning: min 1 yr, PyTorch: min 1 yr, Keras: min 1 yr, Tensorflow: min 1 yr

Key skills: Python, ML, PyTorch, Keras, TensorFlow

Job Responsibilities


Develop, train, and deploy machine learning models using TensorFlow and/or PyTorch.
Implement machine learning models and preprocessing pipelines using Scikit-learn.
Apply supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, including SVM, Decision Trees, Random Forest, and k-NN, to solve complex problems.
Design and implement deep learning architectures such as CNNs, RNNs, GANs, and transfer learning models.
Explore and apply reinforcement learning techniques to enhance AI solutions.


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 2+ years of experience as a Python-focused Engineer.
1+ years of experience with Python-based frameworks for machine learning.
Proficiency in TensorFlow and/or PyTorch for model development and deployment.
Strong knowledge of Scikit-learn for machine learning model implementation.
In-depth understanding of supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, as well as deep learning architectures.


Nice To Have


Experience with Keras for quick prototyping of deep learning models.
Proficiency in Pandas and Numpy for data manipulation and preprocessing.
Familiarity with Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications in AI.
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills.

LLM - Python for Machine Learning

Experience: 2 - 15 Years

Location- Permanent Remote Anywhere in the world

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, 5 hours Mandatory overlap with PST

Total Years Of exp- 2+ years Mandatory

Mandatory Skills- Python: min 2 years, Python for Data Science: min 1 yr, Machine Learning: min 1 yr, PyTorch: min 1 yr, Keras: min 1 yr, Tensorflow: min 1 yr

Key skills: Python, ML, PyTorch, Keras, TensorFlow

Job Responsibilities

  • Develop, train, and deploy machine learning models using TensorFlow and/or PyTorch.
  • Implement machine learning models and preprocessing pipelines using Scikit-learn.
  • Apply supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, including SVM, Decision Trees, Random Forest, and k-NN, to solve complex problems.
  • Design and implement deep learning architectures such as CNNs, RNNs, GANs, and transfer learning models.
  • Explore and apply reinforcement learning techniques to enhance AI solutions.

Job Requirements

  • Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • At least 2+ years of experience as a Python-focused Engineer.
  • 1+ years of experience with Python-based frameworks for machine learning.
  • Proficiency in TensorFlow and/or PyTorch for model development and deployment.
  • Strong knowledge of Scikit-learn for machine learning model implementation.
  • In-depth understanding of supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, as well as deep learning architectures.

Nice To Have

  • Experience with Keras for quick prototyping of deep learning models.
  • Proficiency in Pandas and Numpy for data manipulation and preprocessing.
  • Familiarity with Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications in AI.
  • Excellent spoken and written English communication skills.

Title: Junior Data Scientist(Causal AI)
Description:
Junior Data Scientist

London Hybrid Working

Competitive Salary offering - Permanent Opportunity




The Role

We're seeking a Junior Data Scientist based in London to join our team in spreading Causal AI technology across industries. This entry-level position offers significant growth opportunities. As a Junior Data Scientist, you'll contribute to developing causal-AI-driven models and applications to address high-impact challenges in sectors like retail, marketing, supply chain, manufacturing, and finance.




What You'll Do

Assist in data preparation and cleaning using Python or other programming languages
Learn and apply basic machine learning algorithms to analyze and extract insights from data
Collaborate with senior data scientists to develop and implement causal models
Contribute to the development of data pipelines and workflows
Assist in the creation of data visualizations to communicate findings




Job Requirements

Master's degree in a STEM subject, ideally Computer Science or Engineering
Strong foundation in data analysis and statistics
Proficiency in Python or another programming language
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Matplotlib, Seaborn)
Knowledge or experience in AI and ML
Experience or knowledge in Causal AI
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
A passion for learning and applying data science techniques

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a talented, innovative, and passionate Data Scientist to join our dynamic digital team. In line with our core values of innovation, evidence-based decision-making, integrity, teamwork, and respect, you will be instrumental in advancing our digital products and enhancing our machine capabilities. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyze complex datasets, develop predictive models, and extract actionable insights that will help shape our digital solutions and optimize device usage. Your work will directly contribute to our mission to save lives.

Key Responsibilities:

Analyze clinical and machine-generated datasets to extract actionable insights.
Collaborate with various departments to understand data needs and offer analytical support.
Identify ways to enhance product performance and improve patient outcomes.
Maintain high data quality and integrity through effective data governance practices.
Partner with IT and Digital teams to streamline and enhance data processing workflows.
Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in data science, particularly in transplantation research.
Foster a culture of innovation and continuous improvement in digital solutions, in line with the organization’s values of evidence and integrity.




Skills and Experience:

Proven experience in collaborating with both internal and external teams to successfully deliver projects.
Proficiency in technical computing languages such as Python, R, MATLAB, or Julia.
Experience with data analysis libraries like SciPy, NumPy, Pandas, PyTorch, or related R packages.
Competency in general-purpose programming languages such as C#, F#, Java, or Scala.
Familiarity with the .NET framework, VS Code, and SQL databases.
Hands-on experience with signal processing techniques and predictive analytics.
Strong foundation in descriptive statistics and machine learning techniques.
Preferably experienced in integrating data from third-party APIs and creating research tools like R packages or Jupyter Notebooks.
Background in life sciences, medical devices, digital health, or predictive maintenance is desirable.




Qualifications:

Master’s or PhD in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
Certifications in data science or machine learning are a plus.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and experience in troubleshooting complex issues.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, reflecting a commitment to teamwork and respect.




If this is of interest, please apply or reach out to matthew.downs@biotalent.com to discuss further!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The ideal candidate's favorite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers. 

 

Responsibilities
Analyze raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processing
Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
Collaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
Generate actionable insights for business improvements




Qualifications

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
At least 1 - 2 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modeling
Deep understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau)

  • Analyze raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processing
  • Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist (retail customer data experience)

Salary £45,000 to £55,000 Dependent on Experience

Location - Virtually remote working with 2 days a month self-funded into the Hampshire offices

Ref: J12811




Working within the Analytics and Data Science team, under the leadership of the Data Science Manager, the Data Scientist will work to produce complex data science models and analytical projects. You will interact with a variety of stakeholders and business functions to drive up the understanding of customers across the organisation, helping to shape the Company’s future strategies, improve customer experience, deepen engagement, drive revenue, and improve business efficiencies.




Key Accountabilities / Responsibilities:




Develop new and improve existing models of customer behaviour under the direction of the data manager within the team. Be that churn models, time series forecast models, value assessment of the customer base or other more specific and target models.
Contribute to develop new and improve existing segmentations that can used in marketing activity and across the business, to both help target and describe customers.
Deploy models into production so they can be consumed by other analytical teams across the business.
Deliver complex descriptive and predictive customer behavioural analytics.
Bring external thinking to the Company by maintaining an awareness of analytics usage in retail and other sectors and by keeping abreast of competitor technology and developments.
Support the growth of new channels, Services, Digital, Market Place and Retail Media through the use of “Next Best Offer” engines and other models and segmentations.
Build relationships with key stakeholders from across the business, with the Data Science Manager, helping to translate their ambitions and goals into data science products.




Required Skills & Experience:




Proven experience of working with retail customer data
Experience in either Python or R with a strong ability to use SQL.
You’ve excellent analytical skills and statistical understanding, including experience with: predictive modelling, segmentation, time series analysis and have had hands-on experience in their application.
·Experience using cloud based analytical platforms such as Databricks, Snowflake, Google BigQuery etc is advantageous
Understand the importance of Data Governance and good Data Quality.
Strong attention to detail and willingness to take the time to ensure the accuracy of your work.
Experience of using Jira/Confluence for managing workloads and documentation.
You understand and maximise the value of analysis and data science, and act with a commercial lens, prioritising the actions and usefulness of outputs.
You’re a good storyteller who can bring that value to others - you know numbers don’t always speak for themselves and have excellent visuals to support.
You have an awareness and understanding of technology and trends in Data Science and Analytics




Additional Requirements:

Candidates must have an existing right to live and work in the UK.




If you would like to work in a collaborative, fast paced, encouraging and future thinking environment, where you’re empowered to be creative and drive performance… then this could be your next role. Apply today!




Alternatively, you can refer a friend or colleague by taking part in our fantastic referral schemes! If you have a friend or colleague who would be interested in this role, please refer them to us. For each relevant candidate that you introduce to us (there is no limit) and we place, you will be entitled to our general gift/voucher scheme.




Datatech is one of the UK’s leading recruitment agencies in the field of analytics and host of the critically acclaimed event, Women in Data. For more information, visit our website: www.datatech.org.uk

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Pricing)
Description:
At Zego, we know that traditional motor insurance holds good drivers back. It's too complicated, too expensive, and it doesn't take into account how well you actually drive. 

That's why, since 2016, we've been on a mission to change all of that. Our mission at Zego is to offer the lowest priced insurance for good drivers.

From van drivers and gig workers to everyday car drivers, our customers are our driving force — they're at the heart of everything we do.

We've sold tens of millions of policies so far, and raised over $200 million in funding. And we're only just getting started.

Who we're looking for



We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist (Pricing) to be a pivotal contributor to our Pricing, Tooling, and Modelling team. This role involves building sophisticated risk and market models, conducting rigorous analyses, and providing actionable insights to optimise our insurance pricing strategies. As well as building these models, you will play an active role in improving and extending our analytics tooling.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and refine risk, demand, and market models using statistical techniques and actuarial methods
Analyse insurance data to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for improvements
Collaborate with the technical and street pricing teams to implement pricing changes effectively 
Communicate complex data concepts and model outcomes to a diverse set of stakeholders
Support continuous improvements by integrating new tools and technologies into the pricing process
Required Skills


Education{{:}} Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Data Science or related field
Experience{{:}} Proven experience in non-life insurance pricing and modelling and advanced data science, with a strong focus on model development, deployment, and tooling
Technical Skills{{:}}
Python Proficiency{{:}} Strong Python programming skills, with experience in developing and maintaining analytics packages and tools. Familiarity with data science libraries such as pandas and scikit-learn
SQL{{:}} Proficient in SQL, particularly with cloud data warehouses like Snowflake
Data Tools{{:}} Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms (we're on AWS) and data visualisation tools (Looker, matplotlib, seaborn)
Software Engineering{{:}} Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git), CI/CD pipelines, and software development best practices in a data-intensive environment
Soft Skills{{:}} Excellent communication and project management skills, with a proven ability to work collaboratively across teams and present complex information in a clear, accessible way
Nice To Have


Experience in UK motor insurance
Hands-on experience with insurance pricing tools like Akur8, Emblem or similar pricing modelling tools

What's it like to work at Zego?

Joining Zego is a career-defining move. People go further here, reaching their full potential to achieve extraordinary things. 

We're spread throughout the UK and Europe, and united by our drive to get things done. We're proud of our company and our culture - a friendly and inclusive space where we can lift each other up and celebrate our wins every day.

Together, we're setting the bar higher, delivering exceptional work that makes a difference. Our people are the most important part of our story, and everyone here plays a role. There's loads of room to learn and grow, and you'll get the freedom to steer your career wherever you want.

You'll work alongside a talented group who embrace each other's differences and aren't afraid of a challenge. We recognise our achievements, learn from our mistakes, and help each other to be the best we can be. Together, we're making insurance matter. 

How we work

We believe that teams work better when they have time to collaborate and space to get things done. We call it Zego Hybrid.

Our hybrid way of working is unique. We don't mandate fixed office days. Instead, we foster a flexible approach that empowers every Zegon to perform at their best. We ask you to spend at least one day a week in our central London office. You have the flexibility to choose the day that works best for you and your team. We cover the costs for all company-wide events (3 per year), and also provide a separate hybrid contribution to help pay towards other travel costs. We think it's a good mix of collaborative face time and flexible home-working, setting us up to achieve the right balance between work and life.

Benefits

We reward our people well. Join us and you'll get a market-competitive salary, private medical insurance, company share options, generous holiday allowance, and a whole lot of wellbeing benefits. And that's just for starters.

We're an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

Show more

Title: Junior Engineer
Description:
We are working with an IT company that works with high profile clients throughout the UK, looking after data networks and installing high performance technology. They are looking for a Junior Engineer to join their ranks in the Steeton office. You might not have any experience within the industry currently but if you're the type of person that people come to for help when their struggling with technology, you might be already working in IT or looking to move into it, then this role could be for you.

The position will see you working as part of a 10 person engineering team, initially learning the ropes while being exposed to project and support work. It's the perfect role for someone who wants to get stuck into a technical role and progress within it. Day-to-day, you'll be carrying out project tasks such as product configuration, troubleshooting network and camera equipment, rack installation, cabling, and working with technical documentation. You will also find yourself visiting customer sites with Senior Engineers to install the equipment that you've helped configure and also working with the Projects Team to help keep track of kit for projects needed within the Engineering Team.

To be considered for the role you will need to be passionate about technology and want to develop within the field. The skills you'll need to be able to demonstrate include:


Being happy to talk to people, to ask questions, to speak comfortably with colleagues and customers.
Have basic IT skills, computer literate.
Wanting to fix problems, being curious as to how things work.
Caring about quality.
Taking initiative to create documentation - ‘How to guides’ for example so the next person can learn.
Being courteous.
The ability to follow a process and when there isn’t one, feel empowered to create one.
Wanting to progress and keep learning.
Taking pride in your workspace.


Due to the high security work that you will be involved with and the sites that you'll be travelling to, you will need:


The ability to obtain Security Clearance and Non-Police Personnel Vetting (NPPV3).
A full driving licence and access to your own vehicle.


If you have any questions or require any further information, please contact the team at Rotherwood
Show more

Title: Senior Software Engineer (Python)
Description:
Software Engineer - Python, AWS & Terraform

Full-time - Remote (Must be a UK-based Developer)

£60,000 + Benefits including 33 Days Holiday, 6% Pension & More

Are you a Software Engineer with Python and Cloud experience looking to join an organisation where your development skills will genuinely make an impact?

Do you want to be part of a team that plays a pivotal role in building a world-class platform that is transforming healthcare and improving lives?

WRK Digital is delighted to partner with an innovative healthcare company whose software is used by millions of people in the UK daily, enhancing lives. Ranked among the top HealthTech organisations worldwide, the team is committed to developing the next generation of healthcare technology that truly makes a difference.

Their products lead the way in delivering patient-centered, connected, digitally-enabled health and care services. Working closely with key customers in the healthcare sector-including the NHS- the solutions are used in every setting, from GP surgeries and community care to high street pharmacies, hospitals, clinics, and specialist R&D services.

As a Software Engineer, you'll be working on cloud infrastructure at scale, utilising a tech stack that includes Python, SQL, and Terraform (or CloudFormation), all hosted in AWS.

The team has built a sophisticated data platform to help the NHS manage one of the richest healthcare datasets. Currently, this platform houses 1 petabyte of data and can query 1.5 billion rows per second. This role provides an opportunity to work on Big Data applications and learn technologies such as PySpark, Airflow, Trino, and more.

Its a collaborative, fully remote UK-based team, passionate about their work and committed to having fun along the way. While remote, there is also the option to work from tech hubs in Leeds or London (Paddington) for those who value time on-site. Plus, there are optional quarterly team socials.

The team believe in the power of technology to make healthcare faster, better, and more accessible for all. In this role, you'll spend 75% of your time focused on improving software and 25% working directly with customers to understand their needs and help them leverage the platform. You'll be able to see the real-world impact of your work every day.

Key Responsibilities Include


Involvement in all aspects of the development lifecycle, from architecture and code reviews to testing and hands-on coding
Supporting product enhancements, adding new features, and improving functionality
Collaborating closely with your team, providing guidance to peers, and actively contributing to technical discussions
Developing solutions to complex challenges


We are seeking software engineers who are curious, always looking for ways to improve and innovate. We encourage creative thinking and value autonomy and ownership. If you enjoy taking initiative and are ready to make a meaningful impact in the HealthTech industry, we would be very happy to hear from you.

If you're a Python Software Engineer looking for a role with a high-performing team working on exciting projects, apply now or contact James Westwood at WRK Digital for a confidential conversation about next steps. We look forward to receiving your application!
Show more

Title: Chemical Engineer / Solution Development Engineer
Description:
Job description:

Chemical Engineer / Solution Development Engineer (Chemical Process) 

Hello! Thanks for stopping by. Let us tell you about all the great reasons to join us here at Yorkshire Water:

 

•    We offer a competitive salary, depending on experience – band 4a, £46,172 - £57,716•    A company car lease/allowance scheme•    Annual incentive-related bonus (£1000 maximum Bonus Opportunity for the Performance Year (i.e. from 1st April 2024 to 31st March 2025)•    Attractive pension scheme (up to 10% company contribution)•    Life assurance cover of 4 times pensionable salary•    25 days annual leave plus bank holidays – plus an extra wellness day! (embedded now?)•    A great benefits package – choose from health cash plan scheme, critical illness insurance, dental insurance, life assurance flex and partner cover. •    Retail savings scheme•    Online GP service, cycle to work scheme, gym membership discounts and many more!

    Where I’d work: Knostrop (S. E. Leeds), hybrid working - typically 1 day in the office / week – with extensive travel around the Yorkshire Water region to operational and office sites.

Work type: Permanent. 37 hours per week, Monday – Friday.   

We have an exciting opportunity for a Solution Development Engineer (chemical process) to join us in the Chemical Process team and be a part of helping us give the very best service to our customers. Could this be you?

What we do:

Everyone has an idea of what a water company does. Here in Yorkshire, we make sure that over 5.4 million people living in the region and the millions of people who visit our region each year, can rely on our services, and have clean and safe drinking water on tap and that their wastewater is taken away. But for us, it’s so much more than this.

 

We look after communities, protect the environment, and plan to look after Yorkshire’s water, today, tomorrow 24/7, 365 days a year. We provide essential water and wastewater services to every corner of the Yorkshire region, and play a key role in the region’s health, wellbeing, and prosperity. 

 

New environmental legislation, unprecedented levels of investment and changing expectations from customers means that this is an exciting time to discover opportunities within the water industry. This Engineering role is a key part of how we plan to meet the changing expectations of customers and regulators.  

 

The Company is organised into operating divisions for clean and wastewater. Alongside these is asset delivery, a business unit that serves both clean and waste, providing new and improved assets and a wide range of engineering functions from engineering design, legislative compliance to maintenance strategy.

 

The chemical process team sits within asset delivery and consists of a principal engineer for the discipline and a small group of chemical engineers. We manage DSEAR an COSHH compliance for the business and as part of this, we have a significant capital programme for asset remediation involving a comprehensive site inspection regime, from which springs the compliance documentation and remediation plans. We perform the process design for this remedial work and then generally employ our specialist projects team to complete it. Other activities include creating/maintaining/policing the Yorkshire Water Engineering Specification and authorising engineers from partner organisations to perform specialist work on our behalf. 

 

Where you fit in:

 

As our Solution development engineer (chemical process) you will:

 

•    Carry out and review DSEAR risk assessments, Hazardous Area Classifications and COSHH Risk Assessments•    Technically define scopes of work to enable investigation in support of legislative compliance, particularly DSEAR and COSHH•    Critically appraise output from partners prior to document acceptance and actively engage with them to drive performance and standards•    Assess remedial requirements and provide cost effective process design intent specifications•    Provide technical support and guidance to the internal project delivery team•    Support the discipline Principal Engineer in the development of the Yorkshire Water Engineering Specification and interpretation of industry/national codes

 

What skills & qualifications you’ll need:

 

•    Chemical Engineering degree•    Previous chemical process engineering experience within a process-related engineering operation•    Capable of developing and writing clear and concise engineering standards and specifications•    Commercially aware and able to balance risk and value •    Previous experience of developing process engineering solutions and incorporating these into a work specification for delivery      •    Ability to communicate effectively and present highly technical concepts to a wide audience, not always within the engineering community•    Fit and able to perform medium risk confined space entry and working at height (training provided)

 

You will also benefit from having:

 

•    Training and experience in Hazardous Area Classification•    Training and experience in leading hazard studies•    Competence with drawing creation using AutoCAD® 

 

Although we operate 24 hours a day, 365 days a year, it’s really important to us that we support flexible working patterns and job share options (when we can), to help you make the best of both your work and home life. We know that juggling childcare responsibilities or getting that ideal work/life balance isn’t always easy!

 

Do we sound like your cup of tea?  

 

If you’ve got experience in chemical engineering and want to help us deliver great service for our customers whilst looking after the environment, then be sure to apply today to find out what a career with Yorkshire Water can offer you.  

 

We’re proud to serve the Yorkshire region and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects the communities we serve. We’d really like candidates of all different backgrounds to apply. 

 

If you get the role, you’ll need to undergo pre-employment checks, which include a Basic Disclosure Check, carried out through a Third-Party Company, prior to commencing employment. Depending on the role, you may also be required to go through the security vetting process for either a Counter Terrorist Check or Security Check clearance. 

 

Kelda Group reserve the right to close this position, if necessary. So you don’t miss out, be sure to complete and send through your application as soon as you can.

 

No agencies please.

Show more

Title: Front End Developer Placement Programme
Description:
Are you eager to find web developer jobs and kickstart your career in the coding sector, even without prior formal experience?

If you're organised, creative, dependable, a great technical thinker, and adept at working in a team, brace yourself for a gratifying journey in web development.

We specialise in launching careers in the coding sector through our comprehensive placement program. Our forte lies in offering recognised online coding training, backed by our expert support and recruitment teams. This paves the way for a seamless and often expedited entry into the development or coding realm.

Important Note: This career program caters specifically to entry-level individuals with limited or no prior experience and experienced developers who wish to validate their skills.

How do we make it happen?

Training Excellence: We'll kickstart your journey with a tailored training program, encompassing HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python and other technologies. These courses are hand-picked by us and align with hiring managers and the programming industry expectations.

Crafting Your CV: Once you've passed your exams, our recruitment support team will work closely with you to revamp your CV, ensuring it shines.

Navigating Your Career: Our seasoned recruitment consultants will steer you toward relevant positions based on your newfound qualifications and existing skills. We'll also provide you with interview and career guidance throughout your journey with us.

The training component of our package comes with interest-free financing options, allowing you to invest in your future without the burden of immediate costs. Plus, we're so confident in our ability to land you a placement that if we can't do it within 12 months of your exam success, we'll refund the course fees.

Ready to take the first step towards your future in coding? Enquire now, and one of our expert Course and Career Consultants will be in touch to address your queries and help you embark on this exciting journey.

Title: PLC Software & Comissioning Engineer
Description:
We’re SSV Limited, we design and supply Brewhouses, process vessels, and pipework to the beverage industry, but more about us later, right now as we continue to grow and develop our operations, we are looking for skilled PLC Software & Commissioning Engineer.







What will you do?

You will be responsible for developing, implementing, and optimizing programmable logic controller (PLC) and human-machine interface (HMI) systems within our various offerings, which are primarily bespoke solutions designed and implemented around clients’ specific requirements and specifications. This role requires an in-depth understanding of automation processes, and a proven track record of successful system integration.




We are open to considering applicants with 2-3 years relevant commercial experience all the way up to seasoned, experienced Siemens PLC Software Engineers







What hours will you be working?

In this role you will work 40 hours per week, working predominantly from Monday to Friday however, a flexible and adaptable approach with an ability to work out of normal hours as well as work away on occasion (including weekends) when required







What skills and experience do I need for this role?

Generation of code in Ladder and Structured Control Language for Siemens TIA portal.
Developing HMI/SCADA screens in WinCC
Site commissioning work as part of a team with other engineers
Remote support of existing installations
Know how to read electrical schematics and diagnose faults in control systems
Working in a similar role for at least 3 years
Setup and commissioning of variable speed drives (Danfoss, Invertek or similar)
Profinet, Profibus and IO-link networks
Instrumentation and PID setup and tuning
Fault finding on electrical systems
Dealing with customer queries during and after project warranty periods.
Assisting with on-site customer demonstrations and trials.
Project pre-order research and estimating - meetings with customers and internal.
Assisting with appraisals of project progress and re-estimating of hours/costs.
Involvement in control design meetings - with customers and internal.
Writing of Control Specification documents, FDS documents, FAT documents, operator manuals etc.
Specifying controls hardware requirements - PLCs, remote i/o, fieldbus/hardware communications, HMIs etc.
Assisting with (not responsible for) electrical panel and wiring drawings on AutoCAD.
Hardware integration - building & testing above hardware and inter-device/HMI communications.
Software design & development for control systems involving above equipment - PLCs, field devices, HMIs etc.
Software design & development for SCADA systems.
Taking responsibility for all above aspects of a project on an individual basis or taking responsibility for just some aspects, whilst working together on a team project.
Assisting on other engineer's projects or assisting on customer breakdowns at short notice.







And what about you?

Software development with Siemens PLCs, specifically 1200 or 1500.
Design, modify and code SCADA and HMI systems – Siemens WinCC flexible/Advanced.
Able to work effectively in a team.
Keen eye for detail, able to identify issues and escalate appropriately.
Able to make considered decisions and communicate to relevant colleagues.
Capable of researching technology information to suit the specific task with minimal guidance.
The ability to plan and manage one’s own time and responsibilities with minimal supervision.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to liaise with all departments and suppliers.
You’ll also need a full UK driving licence as you will be travelling as part of your role.




The important bits:

We recognise that your hard work shouldn’t come without its perks, so here’s a little list of some of the things you can expect to get from us:




Great Pay! We believe in rewarding our people for their hard work and as you develop within the company so will your pay!
Take time to relax with 23 days’ holiday plus bank holidays and additional days after just 2 years of service.
Entry into the annual profit pinned company bonus scheme to reward you for all your hard work.
Opportunities for further training and qualifications as you progress in your role.
And most importantly, you’ll be working within a fun, passionate, and vibrant team.




Then finally a bit more about us:

With over 3000 tanks and 80 Brewhouses installed since 2014, we provide unrivaled value and customer service to meet the needs of all drinks manufacturing-related businesses. We are uniquely positioned to be able to provide equipment from 10HL all the way up to 20,000HL to all sectors of the market from brewing, pharmaceutical, dairy and distilling. We also offer a wide range of products including pumps, valves, and fittings all available on our webshop.




Our business is currently expanding through a mixture of market position and strategic acquisitions, so you may see us looking for several roles. Working in a lively and at times challenging environment you’ll take multitasking in your stride and will enjoy balancing admin tasks, events, service and sales - there’s never a dull moment! If you think this is the role for you, hit the apply button and see how you could shape your career with us.







Our Application Process:

SSV Limited is an equal opportunities employer and we welcome people of all ages, ethnicities, gender identities, disabilities, religions and sexual orientations.




You will need the Right to Work in the UK, due to the size of our business we are unable to offer sponsorship for this role.




We Encourage applications from candidates from both commercial and ex-military backgrounds; Royal Navy, British Army and Royal Air Force particularly those from an Electrical Engineering background i.e Royal Signals Electrician, Avionics Technician, Electrical Technician, Avionics Engineer, Marine Engineer, Aircraft Technician or similar.




All applications will be dealt with in the strictest of confidence.




And to all our agency partners, thank you in advance for your interest. We will get in touch if we need any support for any of the vacancies we currently have.

Our Application Process:

SSV Limited is an equal opportunities employer and we welcome people of all ages, ethnicities, gender identities, disabilities, religions and sexual orientations.

All applications will be dealt with in the strictest of confidence.


And to all our agency partners, thank you in advance for your interest. We will get in touch if we need any support for any of the vacancies we currently have.

Title: EUC Engineer
Description:
Role: EUC Engineer
Rate: (up to) £450pd Inside IR35
Location: Leeds (up to 2 days per week on site)
Length: Initial 6 months

Fruition IT are seeing a skilled End User Computing (EUC) Engineer to work with an established Leeds-based organisation. In this role, you will be responsible for maintaining and managing EUC platforms, implementing new technologies, and ensuring a high-quality, trusted service.

EUC Engineer Key Responsibilities

Provide operational support and management of the EUC estate.
Contribute to the ongoing improvement of the client's EUC services and related policies.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver technical changes, support projects, and enhance the experience for the client's members and colleagues.
Identify and mitigate risks, ensuring adherence to relevant security and IT policies.
Deliver innovative EUC solutions, enhancing the client's technology offering across their group.

EUC Engineer Requirements

Essential:

Strong knowledge of Microsoft Windows 10/11, Office 365, SCCM, and Microsoft Intune.
Proven experience troubleshooting technical issues and managing Office 365, Intune, and VDI solutions.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical staff.

Desirable:

Microsoft 365 Modern Desktop Administrator Associate Certification.
Experience with Microsoft Azure, Autopilot, and PowerShell scripting.
Experience with Qualys

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.

Show more

  • Provide operational support and management of the EUC estate.
  • Contribute to the ongoing improvement of the client's EUC services and related policies.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver technical changes, support projects, and enhance the experience for the client's members and colleagues.
  • Identify and mitigate risks, ensuring adherence to relevant security and IT policies.
  • Deliver innovative EUC solutions, enhancing the client's technology offering across their group.

EUC Engineer Requirements

Essential:

  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Windows 10/11, Office 365, SCCM, and Microsoft Intune.
  • Proven experience troubleshooting technical issues and managing Office 365, Intune, and VDI solutions.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical staff.

Desirable:

  • Microsoft 365 Modern Desktop Administrator Associate Certification.
  • Experience with Microsoft Azure, Autopilot, and PowerShell scripting.
  • Experience with Qualys

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.

Title: Controls Software Engineer
Description:
The Opportunity

An excellent opportunity has arisen for a Controls Engineer to work as part of the Commercial Controls Department, based in Leeds.




The Role

Responsibilities for this role include:

Design and code control systems strategies for HVAC applications using Carel, Trend, Tridium Niagara and Siemens controls platforms
Test software using functional test simulators to ensure correct operation
Produce project documentation including control philosophies, O&M manuals, functional test scripts, FMEA reports and BMS points lists
Attend internal and external client/site meetings as necessary to determine initial scope of works and correct functionality during commissioning
Work closely with the Research & Development department to incorporate new technologies and features into projects and report improvements back
Assist with training and mentoring of new engineers and apprentices
Provide technical support for site engineers and customers as required
Be a focal point for customers, helping to resolve any issues and develop our commitment to them
Mainly office based position as an integral part of the project delivery team
Some site work may occasionally be required




Desirable Skills & Experience

Hold a technical degree and/or have experience within the field of controls/BMS
OR Have served a recognised apprenticeship in air conditioning/refrigeration and have good electrical/mechanical knowledge of HVAC, with a desire to learn the software side
Experience with programmable controllers is desirable but not essential – the willingness and capability to learn is essential. Of particular interest: Carel 1tool software and pCO controllers, Trend SET and IQ controllers, Tridium Niagara 4 software and controllers, Siemens Controllers
Capable of understanding and designing control strategies
Experience with HVAC applications and knowledge of cooling and heating systems
Good electrical knowledge and capable of understanding electrical drawings
Have basic knowledge of IT systems and communication networks
Awareness of BMS/DCIM and common communication protocols (Modbus, BACnet, TCP/IP)
Logical and methodical approach to problem solving using own initiative is a must
Have good written & communication skills
Team player
An overall willingness to learn and develop
Full training will be provided for the right applicant




Package Descriptions




Competitive Salary
7% Employer Pension contribution (min 1% employee)
Life assurance
25 days holiday + statutory days
Holiday Purchase scheme
Employee Assistance Programme
Airedale Rewards scheme – discounts on shopping/restaurants/cinema etc
Inhouse training school
Working for a UK based leading manufacturer
High quality of equipment and workwear




About Airedale

At our heart we’re a technology company, working with huge global colocation and hyperscale clients to design, build, install and optimise precision cooling systems that operate 24/7/365 in data centres all over the world. We are engineers, we are problem solvers and we are passionate about the role that air conditioning plays in an increasingly connected world. We’re also passionate about sustainability and we’re part of the Modine group, a global organization with fiscal 2024 revenues of $2.4 billion, who’s vision is to help engineer a cleaner, healthier world.




We kindly request that recruitment agencies do not contact us regarding the position. CVs will only be accepted directly by interested candidates and no speculative CVs will be accepted
